Steve (previous GoodDollar community steward) will act as administrator, answering questions, resolving disputes, and vetoing invalid applications when necessary

Community members and GoodDAO participants will help with review and governance
The broader GoodDollar community will contribute to promotion, education, and feedback

Optional daily claim opt-ins (users can donate a portion of their daily G$)

Direct donations from the community
Campaigns to bring ecosystem partners into the funding flow
answers.question: Roadmap & Milestones: Outline 3-5 key milestones with timeframes demonstrating how you'll deliver value to the GoodDollar ecosystem.

answers.answer:
GoodMicrogrants directly incentivizes real-world G$ adoption by rewarding people who accept G$ as payment for goods and services. Our core strategy is to create a monthly rhythm of visibility and reward, turning everyday sellers into G$ champions.

Key tactics include:

On-chain, reputation-based eligibility using Cubid scores to make applying easy and self-serve

Recurring funding rounds that create consistency and community engagement

Integration with G$-enabled marketplaces, allowing sellers to receive grants automatically

Community-powered promotion through GoodDAO, social media, and grant recipients themselves

We’ll track success through:

Growth in verified sellers applying each round

Volume of G$ transactions linked to eligible sales

Number of recurring grant recipients and first-time applicants

By focusing on rewarding real economic activity, GoodMicrogrants turns G$ into a currency people actually use—and rely on.
answers.question: User Adoption Strategy: How will you attract users to your project and drive G$ adoption? Include specific strategies or metrics. You can find more details on the engagement rewards to support this at: https://engagement-rewards.vercel.app/

answers.answer:
Phase 1: 2-3 weeks
Phase 2: 4–6 weeks
Phase 3: 6–10 weeks
Phase 4: TBD
Phase 5: TBD
answers.question: Funding Allocation: How will you allocate the funding to maximize impact? Provide a simple breakdown of resource allocation.

answers.answer:
GoodMicrogrants complements existing GoodDollar initiatives by focusing on the next stage of the value cycle: not just claiming G$, but actually spending and accepting it. While tools like the Claim Dapp and FaceVerification SDK focus on onboarding users and verifying identity, GoodMicrogrants supports economic activity within the ecosystem by rewarding those who accept G$ in exchange for real goods and services.

It also aligns with the broader goals of:
The GoodDAO — by reinforcing governance and incentivizing verified use cases
GoodDollar marketplaces and classifieds — by plugging into platforms where G$ is already circulating
G$ utility tools — by adding a concrete reward layer for real-world adoption

Rather than competing, it closes the loop—turning verified users into active participants in a growing G$ economy.
answers.question: Ecosystem Contribution: How does your project complement existing initiatives in the GoodDollar ecosystem rather than competing with them?

answers.answer: Yes
answers.question: Ethical Compliance: Confirm you have read and will comply with the ethical standards outlined in the eligibility criteria.

answers.answer:
This proposal is part of a three part series, where the other two proposals are related to Cubid Passport and a new Cubid-SDK.

We love GoodDollar!

project.title: Reviving GoodMicroGrants — Automated, Scalable, and Community-Led
project.description:
# 1. Overview
This proposal aims to bring GoodMicrogrants back to life as a monthly, on-chain, community-powered microgrant program that rewards individuals who sell goods or services in exchange for GoodDollars. The new version of the platform will be lean, partially automated, and fully transparent, lowering the operational burden while expanding its reach and impact globally.

The mission remains the same: amplify GoodDollar’s use as a real economic tool, by supporting those who accept it for value exchange. But with improved infrastructure, automated workflows, and reputation-based eligibility, the program can now scale in ways the original implementation couldn’t.

## Why GoodMicroGrants Matter
The single most impactful thing that could happen to the GoodDollar ecosystem is for sellers to begin accepting GoodDollar as payment. This simple shift transforms GoodDollar from just a claimable token into a usable currency in real life. GoodMicroGrants kickstarts a circular economy where value flows between people, not just into wallets. Every transaction made in GoodDollar deepens its utility, legitimacy, and reach. But for that circular economy to take root, early adopters—especially sellers of goods and services—need support. That’s where GoodMicrogrants comes in: a targeted incentive program to reward and uplift the individuals helping to make GoodDollar real in everyday life.

## How does it work? 
It's simple. As a seller or service provider you first start accepting GoodDollar as payment for your services. Anywhere. Then fill our a simple form to apply to GoodMicroGrants. In the form you describe your "store", the services you sell and which wallet you use to accept payments. You also get verified as a real human through Cubid. After you application is approved you don't need to do anything else. Just keep selling. And then at the end of the month GoodMicroGrants would send you some extra GoodDollar as a matching contribution. The amount you get will depend on how many unique customers you had vs how many all other sellers had, and the available GoodDollars in the matching pool.

# 2. Project Objective
The goal of this project is to revive GoodMicrogrants as a global, recurring monthly funding round focused exclusively on GoodDollar sellers—individuals who accept GoodDollar for goods, services, or peer-to-peer exchanges (e.g. selling used items).

The system will:
- Automate key parts of the application, review, and distribution pipeline
- Replace manual BrightID verification with Cubid-score-based eligibility
- Operate with optimistic approvals and on-chain transparency
- Introduce a lightweight governance and review layer via the GoodDAO
- Rebuild the site as a modern, modular dApp + indexer stack
- Enable future expansion into local and regional microgrant variants


# 3. Key Features & Proposed Improvements
We will deliver this project as five different sub-projects  / phases.

## Phase 1: Replace BrightID with Cubid-Score for Eligibility
The previous version relied on BrightID for human verification. We're proposing to replace that with a Cubid humanity score threshold to determine applicant eligibility. This change unlocks the ability to:
- Automate eligibility checks
- Support self-service onboarding
- Reward users with deeper web3 identity graphs
- Tie into existing Cubid integrations across the ecosystem

Optimistic approvals will be granted to anyone who meets the application criteria and exceeds the Cubid score threshold. Applications can be vetoed by a designated admin (Steve) if necessary.

BrightID can still potentially be still used as a soft requirement in parallel with Cubid, or as a second layer prior to distributing a grant, but should not be the first requirement as it is not fully self-serve nor permissionless. 

## Phase 2: Add DAO Oversight for Veto Power and Legitimacy
While applications will be optimistically approved, a lightweight governance layer will be added in Phase 2:
- Use the GoodDAO (or a separate microDAO) to review incoming applications
- Allow DAO members to flag or veto bad actors or ineligible submissions
- Optionally, introduce snapshot-based voting or Cubid-weighted governance for future iterations

This adds credibility, trust, and decentralization without bottlenecking the flow of funds.

## Phase 3: Rebuild as a Light dApp with an Indexer
The existing GoodMicrogrants site will be rebuilt into a lightweight dApp that includes:
- Wallet connect and Rainbow kit for login
- On-chain application submissions
- Live display of past winners and funded projects
- Indexer integration for programmatic view of who sold what, when, and for how much
- Basic analytics (e.g. average grant size, total funds distributed)
- Optional integration of quadratic matching logic either via a spreadsheet feed or built-in calculation

An indexer will be developed to:
- Track GoodDollar spending activity related to sales of goods or services
- Prepare structured data for each round
- Reduce reliance on manual spreadsheet tracking

This makes the program scalable, transparent, and compatible with future automation layers.

## Phase 4. Integrate with Marketplaces for Direct Grants
Where possible, microgrants will be distributed based on verified GoodDollar sales processed through:
- Marketplaces where payments are tracked on-chain
- Classifieds platforms that natively accept and record GoodDollar transactions

This removes the need for manual applications altogether in some cases. Sellers who use online marketplace platforms without on-chain payments will still be able to apply manually through the dApp, provided they meet the Cubid score threshold.

## Phase 5. Add Community-Funding Mechanisms
To increase funding and sustainability, the program will be supplemented by:
- Optional daily claim opt-ins (users can donate a portion of their daily G$)
- Matching fund contributions from aligned DAOs and protocols
- Direct donations from the community
- Campaigns to bring ecosystem partners into the funding flow

Note: SDK fee mechanisms will not be included.


# 4. Roles and Team
- Steve (previous GoodDollar community steward) will act as administrator, answering questions, resolving disputes, and vetoing invalid applications when necessary
- Noak (previous GoodDollar Developer Evangelist) will act as sponsor, architect and mentor
- Community Developers will build and maintain the lightweight dApp and indexer. We will source developers through the community Telegram channels, forum, and potentially also through DeWork depending on how much grants we end up getting.
- Community members and GoodDAO participants will help with review and governance
- The broader GoodDollar community will contribute to promotion, education, and feedback


# 5. Technical Architecture
- Frontend: Next.js / React-based dApp with wallet connect and on-chain submission UI
- Backend/Indexing: Custom indexer for tracking eligible transactions and preparing round data
- Eligibility: Verified via Cubid humanity score threshold
- Governance: Optimistic approvals with DAO-based veto capability
- Grant Distribution: Fully on-chain, public, and auditable


# 6. Timeline & Scope
This proposal focuses on delivering a light, community-driven MVP, designed to support monthly grant rounds with very low operational overhead.

Estimated time to deploy MVP, after the conclusion of Gitcoin 23. 
- Phase 1: 2-3 weeks
- Phase 2: 4–6 weeks
- Phase 3: 6–10 weeks
- Phase 4: TBD
- Phase 5: TBD

Disclaimer: Depending on the amount of grants awarded and the amount of volunteer community support we receive, we may implement this project partially or slower than outlined above.

Future improvements—including a robust quadratic voting UI, advanced analytics, or deeper DAO integrations—can be explored once the MVP proves itself and additional funding becomes available through Gitcoin or other channels.


# 7. Funding Model
This proposal is submitted as a retroactive public goods grant, intended for consideration via Gitcoin or similar platforms. No upfront funding is required; instead, we aim to show tangible impact and earn support based on results.


# 8. In Closing
GoodMicrogrants is a simple but powerful idea that deserves a second life. With a modern, modular design and light operational footprint, it can now become a reliable, recurring way to reward real GoodDollar usage around the world. Sellers get support. The ecosystem gets activity. And the community gets a transparent, replicable model for micro-economic empowerment.

Let’s bring it back—stronger, smarter, and ready to grow.

answers.answer: This project introduces an AI-powered tipping agent designed to seamlessly integrate crypto-native monetization and community engagement into X (formerly Twitter). By leveraging G$ and Celo infrastructure, the agent enables peer-to-peer micro-transactions, gamified rewards, and transparent analytics—all accessible via simple X posts.  The agent allows users to set up crypto wallets linked to their X accounts, tip creators instantly using G$, run raffles/giveaways, and withdraw funds to external Celo addresses. Creators can view detailed analytics about their top supporters, while fans are incentivized to engage more through potential rewards and recognition. These features not only empower creators to earn directly from their audience but also cultivate deeper relationships within their communities.  By using G$ as the primary tipping currency, the project drives real-world utility and adoption of the token. It demonstrates how G$ can be used for fast micro-payments on social platforms—promoting financial inclusion and creator independence in a decentralized economy. The frictionless user experience encourages broader participation in the G$ ecosystem, enhancing its relevance and visibility in the crypto space.
answers.question: Project Description: Briefly describe your project and how it enhances G$ utility or adoption

answers.answer: The AI Agent will use the identity-sdk to check that the users that take part in the giveaways are unique and not a bot army so that the giveaway is fair to every participant. The implementation plan is to check if the address that the users use is a verified one.
answers.question: Technical Implementation: Describe your approach and how it integrates with GoodDollar. For new builders, outline your implementation plan.

answers.answer: Currently, I am the only member on my team and I have experience in front-end, back-end and smart contract development. My github is https://github.com/spyros-zikos?tab=repositories and there you can find all of my projects. The most difficult so far is the stablecoin one https://github.com/spyros-zikos/foundry-defi-stablecoin where I made an ethereum-backed stablecoin. My favorite project is the raffle on https://github.com/spyros-zikos/foundry-raffle where I used chainlink's VRF and Automation Upkeep.
answers.question: Team Capability: Highlight your team's relevant experience and past delivery of similar projects, particularly in the Web3 space or with GoodDollar. Please add relevant links to members GitHub, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc as needed.

answers.answer:
Milestone 1: Make the sdk integration. (1 month)
Milestone 2: Finish agent development and deploy on Celo and test manually the agent. (1 month)
Milestone 3: Have an audit and do marketing. (2 month)
answers.question: Roadmap & Milestones: Outline 3-5 key milestones with timeframes demonstrating how you'll deliver value to the GoodDollar ecosystem.

answers.answer: I will use the agent to make marketing giveaways for other users and that will both make users familiar with the agent and will attract a lot of traffic. The metric that is most important is the number of tips that are taking place each day. The marketing giveaways will increase this metric and will educate users on how to use the agent.

Identity-sdk integration: $1000
Testing: $1000
Audit: $2000-$10000
Marketing: $1000

answers.answer: Currently, no other tipping agent exists in the GoodDollar ecosystem so it will not compete against other projects but will offer something new to the ecosystem.

project.title: Tip This Creator
project.description:
# Problem Statement
Despite the growing popularity of content platforms like X (formerly Twitter), content creators often face challenges in monetizing their work effectively and engaging their audience in meaningful ways. Traditional monetization methods are limited, slow, and often platform-dependent, creating barriers for both creators and their supporters.

There is a lack of seamless, crypto-native tools that enable fans to support creators directly, transparently, and in real time. Furthermore, there are few incentives or gamified features that can enhance audience participation and reward loyal supporters.

Additionally, existing tipping and donation systems do not offer insights into user behavior or history, making it difficult for creators to track engagement or reward top supporters. Withdrawal of funds is often a manual, complex process, especially when integrating with external crypto wallets.

This project aims to solve these problems by introducing an AI-powered agent that simplifies and enhances creator monetization through the following features:

- Creation of crypto wallets linked to X accounts
- Instant peer-to-peer tipping in crypto
- Community engagement tools like raffles and giveaways
- Detailed tipping statistics and analytics
- Easy withdrawal of funds to external Ethereum addresses

By leveraging AI and blockchain, this solution empowers content creators and fans alike with a decentralized, transparent, and engaging support ecosystem.

# About

This project is about an AI Agent that helps X users support their favorite content creators. It also allows content creators to better monetize their content and to boost engagement. All that with crypto! The Agent can
1. Create 'twitter' wallets
2. Send tips from one X user to another
3. Create giveaways/raffles (for the tippers of a user)
4. Show statistics about tipping history
5. Send ETH from 'twitter' account to external address (withdrawal of funds)

# How it's made

- The AI agent is based on a fork of the eliza-starter repository. It implements one provider and four actions.
- The tips that take place are routed through a smart contract which keeps a 10% fee. This smart contract was developed with solidity using the Foundry framework and was deployed on Base Mainnet. It's main purpose is to collect fees and emit events.
- The 'twitter' wallets are created and managed with the CPD-SDK.
- The user statistics and the winner giveaways use The Graph to access and query onchain data.
- The agent data are stored on two sqlite databases.

# Instructions

How to use this AI agent for tipping (and giveaways if you are a content creator) with (Base) ETH.


1. How to setup your "twitter" address/wallet:

You only have to setup your address if you want to tip someone. If you want to receive tips there is no setup required.
To setup your "twitter" wallet tag the agent at any post/reply. The agent will tell you your public address. Fund this addess by transfering Base ETH to it from an external wallet (like metamask).

2. How to tip:

Before tipping make sure that you transfer some funds to your address from step 1.

The creator that you tip does not need to do any setup/interactions with the agent. Any creator can be tipped.

The default tipping amount is 0.0004 (~$0.10) but you can tip with less or more than that by specifying the tip amount (see below). If you tip with the default amount but you don't have enough balance, then the tip amount will be equal to you balance.

2.1 Tip by posting

You can tip by tagging the agent and the creator that you want to tip. Do not tag any other users.

Your message has to indicate that you want to tip the creator. To indicate that, you can
1) Say nothing (just tag the agent and the creator). Example of such post: "@agent @creator"
2) Provide the amount you want to tip (in ETH) while also tagging the agent and the creator. Examples: "@agent @creator 0.001", "0.001 ETH @creator @agent"
3) Say something more descriptive which indicates that you want to tip the tagged creator. Optionally you can include the amount of the tip. Examples "@agent tip this creator @creator please", "could you @agent tip this @creator 0.001 ETH?"

2.2 Tip by replying

You can tip by tagging the agent at the replies of a post from the creator of your choice. Do not tag any other users.

Your message has to indicate that you want to tip the creator. To indicate that, you can
1) Say nothing (just tag the agent). Example of such reply: "@agent"
2) Provide the amount you want to tip (in ETH) while also tagging the agent. Examples: "@agent 0.001", "0.001 ETH @agent"
3) Say something more descriptive which indicates that you want to tip the creator that made the post that you're replying to. Optionally you can include the amount of the tip. Examples "@agent tip this creator please", "could you @agent tip this creator 0.001 ETH?"


3. How to withdraw:

To withdraw you need to make a post that mentions/tags the agent and includes the wallet address that you want to withdraw to. Examples of such posts: "@agent 0x1231231231231231231231231231231231231231", "withdraw 0x1231231231231231231231231231231231231231 @agent"

4. How to do a giveaway:

When you do a giveaway you randomly choose a user from those that have tipped you (any amount) and you send them the balance that you 'twitter' wallet has.

In order to do a giveaway you need to have been tipped by at least one user.

To do a giveaway, make a post tagging the agent and indicate that you want to do a giveaway. Examples of such posts: "@agent giveaway", "GIVEAWAYYYY @agent", "give awaaaay!!! @agent", "yo, @agent do a giveaway now"

5. How to see the address and/or balance of your 'twitter' wallet

Make a post tagging the agent and asking for your address and/or balance. Examples of such posts: "@agent tell my balance", "balance @agent", "show me address @agent"

6. How to see statistics about your tipping history

Make a post tagging the agent and asking for statistics. Examples of such posts: "@agent stats", "statistics @agent", "show me some stats @agent"


Notes:
This agent cannot be tipped.
Fee on tips: 10%
Default tip amount: 0.00004 ETH (~$0.10)
When calculating the balance of the 'twitter' wallet and when making a tip/withdrawal/giveaway, a small amount of ETH (0.000005 ETH (~$0.01)) is withheld by the 'twitter' wallet to be spent in gas fees. This amount cannot be withdrawn.

metadata.title: Tip This Creator
metadata.description:
# Problem Statement
Despite the growing popularity of content platforms like X (formerly Twitter), content creators often face challenges in monetizing their work effectively and engaging their audience in meaningful ways. Traditional monetization methods are limited, slow, and often platform-dependent, creating barriers for both creators and their supporters.

There is a lack of seamless, crypto-native tools that enable fans to support creators directly, transparently, and in real time. Furthermore, there are few incentives or gamified features that can enhance audience participation and reward loyal supporters.

Additionally, existing tipping and donation systems do not offer insights into user behavior or history, making it difficult for creators to track engagement or reward top supporters. Withdrawal of funds is often a manual, complex process, especially when integrating with external crypto wallets.

This project aims to solve these problems by introducing an AI-powered agent that simplifies and enhances creator monetization through the following features:

- Creation of crypto wallets linked to X accounts
- Instant peer-to-peer tipping in crypto
- Community engagement tools like raffles and giveaways
- Detailed tipping statistics and analytics
- Easy withdrawal of funds to external Ethereum addresses

By leveraging AI and blockchain, this solution empowers content creators and fans alike with a decentralized, transparent, and engaging support ecosystem.

# About

This project is about an AI Agent that helps X users support their favorite content creators. It also allows content creators to better monetize their content and to boost engagement. All that with crypto! The Agent can
1. Create 'twitter' wallets
2. Send tips from one X user to another
3. Create giveaways/raffles (for the tippers of a user)
4. Show statistics about tipping history
5. Send ETH from 'twitter' account to external address (withdrawal of funds)

# How it's made

- The AI agent is based on a fork of the eliza-starter repository. It implements one provider and four actions.
- The tips that take place are routed through a smart contract which keeps a 10% fee. This smart contract was developed with solidity using the Foundry framework and was deployed on Base Mainnet. It's main purpose is to collect fees and emit events.
- The 'twitter' wallets are created and managed with the CPD-SDK.
- The user statistics and the winner giveaways use The Graph to access and query onchain data.
- The agent data are stored on two sqlite databases.

# Instructions

How to use this AI agent for tipping (and giveaways if you are a content creator) with (Base) ETH.


1. How to setup your "twitter" address/wallet:

You only have to setup your address if you want to tip someone. If you want to receive tips there is no setup required.
To setup your "twitter" wallet tag the agent at any post/reply. The agent will tell you your public address. Fund this addess by transfering Base ETH to it from an external wallet (like metamask).

2. How to tip:

Before tipping make sure that you transfer some funds to your address from step 1.

The creator that you tip does not need to do any setup/interactions with the agent. Any creator can be tipped.

The default tipping amount is 0.0004 (~$0.10) but you can tip with less or more than that by specifying the tip amount (see below). If you tip with the default amount but you don't have enough balance, then the tip amount will be equal to you balance.

2.1 Tip by posting

You can tip by tagging the agent and the creator that you want to tip. Do not tag any other users.

Your message has to indicate that you want to tip the creator. To indicate that, you can
1) Say nothing (just tag the agent and the creator). Example of such post: "@agent @creator"
2) Provide the amount you want to tip (in ETH) while also tagging the agent and the creator. Examples: "@agent @creator 0.001", "0.001 ETH @creator @agent"
3) Say something more descriptive which indicates that you want to tip the tagged creator. Optionally you can include the amount of the tip. Examples "@agent tip this creator @creator please", "could you @agent tip this @creator 0.001 ETH?"

2.2 Tip by replying

You can tip by tagging the agent at the replies of a post from the creator of your choice. Do not tag any other users.

Your message has to indicate that you want to tip the creator. To indicate that, you can
1) Say nothing (just tag the agent). Example of such reply: "@agent"
2) Provide the amount you want to tip (in ETH) while also tagging the agent. Examples: "@agent 0.001", "0.001 ETH @agent"
3) Say something more descriptive which indicates that you want to tip the creator that made the post that you're replying to. Optionally you can include the amount of the tip. Examples "@agent tip this creator please", "could you @agent tip this creator 0.001 ETH?"


3. How to withdraw:

To withdraw you need to make a post that mentions/tags the agent and includes the wallet address that you want to withdraw to. Examples of such posts: "@agent 0x1231231231231231231231231231231231231231", "withdraw 0x1231231231231231231231231231231231231231 @agent"

4. How to do a giveaway:

When you do a giveaway you randomly choose a user from those that have tipped you (any amount) and you send them the balance that you 'twitter' wallet has.

In order to do a giveaway you need to have been tipped by at least one user.

To do a giveaway, make a post tagging the agent and indicate that you want to do a giveaway. Examples of such posts: "@agent giveaway", "GIVEAWAYYYY @agent", "give awaaaay!!! @agent", "yo, @agent do a giveaway now"

5. How to see the address and/or balance of your 'twitter' wallet

Make a post tagging the agent and asking for your address and/or balance. Examples of such posts: "@agent tell my balance", "balance @agent", "show me address @agent"

6. How to see statistics about your tipping history

Make a post tagging the agent and asking for statistics. Examples of such posts: "@agent stats", "statistics @agent", "show me some stats @agent"


Notes:
This agent cannot be tipped.
Fee on tips: 10%
Default tip amount: 0.00004 ETH (~$0.10)
When calculating the balance of the 'twitter' wallet and when making a tip/withdrawal/giveaway, a small amount of ETH (0.000005 ETH (~$0.01)) is withheld by the 'twitter' wallet to be spent in gas fees. This amount cannot be withdrawn.

answers.answer: The H.E.R. DAO StoryLab is a 6-week creative accelerator that brings together storytellers, developers, and marketers to produce human-centered content that showcases how G$ tokens and the GoodDollar ecosystem are creating real-world impact particularly across the Global South. Participants develop culturally resonant videos, social campaigns, and creative assets that highlight G$ utility in driving financial inclusion. This project is designed to meet the Marketing & Growth Hacking track by transforming technical features into relatable narratives. It supports user adoption and community onboarding through media assets, expanding awareness and driving engagement with GoodDollar across diverse markets.
answers.question: Project Description: Briefly describe your project and how it enhances G$ utility or adoption

answers.answer: Our approach is rooted in collaboration between creatives and developers to bring the GoodDollar ecosystem to life through story. Developers play a key role in guiding the technical integrity of each project, helping integrate tools like the G$ Identity SDK, wallet functionality, and token-based services into the storytelling process. They work alongside storytellers to ensure the content accurately reflects how GoodDollar works on the ground, whether it’s claiming UBI, creating a wallet, or understanding protocol benefits. Together, teams translate these features into narratives designed to onboard new users and deepen community understanding. Through mentorship, technical support, and an ecosystem driven focus, we ensure each piece of content drives meaningful engagement and adoption across diverse communities.
answers.question: Technical Implementation: Describe your approach and how it integrates with GoodDollar. For new builders, outline your implementation plan.

answers.answer:
H.E.R. DAO is a globally recognized and impact-driven DAO with a strong track record of running developer hackathons, tech residencies, and educational events across Africa, Asia, Europe, LATAM, North America. The DAO has supported thousands of developers and creatives, with a specific focus on expanding access to Web3 opportunities in the Global South and building inclusive blockchain ecosystems. Its network includes technical mentors, builders, and storytellers who collaborate to bring blockchain tools to life through practical, real-world applications.

The creative lead for this project is H.E.R. DAO’s Creative Director, April Walker, a filmmaker, Creative Director and strategist with over 8 years of experience telling human stories that explore social impact, innovation, and transformation. Her focus in this initiative is to make emerging technologies like Web3 more relatable and accessible by combining storytelling, ecosystem design, and strategic growth.

Links:
H.E.R. DAO Twitter: https://x.com/_HerDAO
H.E.R. DAO LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/h-e-r-dao
April Walker LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/aprilwalkerfilms/

answers.answer:
Roadmap & Milestones:

Week 1: Program Launch & Team Formation:

- Recruit and onboard a diverse cohort of storytellers, developers, and marketers ( Starting with the H.E.R DAO community)

- Run introductory sessions on GoodDollar, Web3 fundamentals, and storytelling strategy.
Participants form teams and select story concepts aligned with GoodDollar's mission.

Weeks 2–4: Mentorship, Development & Content Creation:
- Weekly expert led workshops covering Web3 storytelling, marketing, and growth.

- Teams begin developing story projects, integrating real-world G$ token use and exploring community impact.

- Developers collaborate on any interactive elements or technical storytelling formats (e.g., dApps, community tools).

Week 5: Testing, Feedback & Refinement:

- Internal showcase for feedback from mentors and the H.E.R. DAO network.

- Teams revise and refine their projects to align with ecosystem goals, utility education, and community resonance.

Week 6: Public Launch & Media Distribution:

- Final projects are presented in a global showcase and shared across multiple platforms.

- Teams receive marketing support their content and drive engagement with GoodDollar.

- Content rollout across H.E.R. DAO and partner platforms to reach emerging market audiences.

Post-Program: Growth & Community Integration (Ongoing):

- Media assets continue to support onboarding, education, and ecosystem awareness.

- High potential projects may receive continued support from GoodDollar.
answers.question: Roadmap & Milestones: Outline 3-5 key milestones with timeframes demonstrating how you'll deliver value to the GoodDollar ecosystem.

answers.answer:
We’ll use the H.E.R. DAO Story Lab to attract and onboard new users through stories that make G$ feel useful and relevant. These stories will spotlight real people and communities engaging with G$ in everyday ways, breaking down Web3 in a relatable way and building trust.

Our adoption strategy includes:

- Creative storytelling campaigns designed to educate and guide users to claim G$ and set up wallets.

- Community storytelling challenges, where people share their own G$ experiences and earn rewards through the Engagement Rewards platform.

- Practical use case mapping, encouraging peer-to-peer transactions and everyday utility within local ecosystems.

We’ll measure success through custom onboarding links, story submissions, and platform activity tracking wallet signups, G$ claimed, shared stories and user engagement. We’ll use Engagement Rewards to track key user actions like wallet signups, story submissions, and referrals  and automatically reward participants with G$. This allows us to grow organically while measuring real impact.
answers.question: User Adoption Strategy: How will you attract users to your project and drive G$ adoption? Include specific strategies or metrics. You can find more details on the engagement rewards to support this at: https://engagement-rewards.vercel.app/

answers.answer:
We’ll allocate funding to maximize quality content and community engagement:

Content Creation (40%) – Producing high-quality stories (video, written, audio) that educate and inspire action

Community Incentives (25%) – G$ rewards for users who submit stories, refer others, or participate in challenges

Marketing & Distribution (20%) – Promoting stories across platforms to expand visibility and drive adoption

Tech & Tools (10%) – Basic infrastructure like site updates, tracking tools, and integrations with Engagement Rewards

Project Management (5%) – Coordination, monitoring impact, and reporting
answers.question: Funding Allocation: How will you allocate the funding to maximize impact? Provide a simple breakdown of resource allocation.

answers.answer:
Our project fits right into the GoodDollar ecosystem by adding a story-driven marketing and growth layer that supports existing initiatives rather than competing with them. While others focus on building tools or onboarding directly, the H.E.R. DAO Story Lab highlights the real-life “why” behind G$ by showing how it’s being used in everyday situations through powerful, relatable storytelling.

By sharing these real experiences, we help shine a light on the work already happening in the ecosystem, making it easier for people to connect with and understand the value of G$. It’s about meeting people where they are and showing them what’s possible. Through our integration with Engagement Rewards, we’ll also fuel organic growth by rewarding users for actions like referrals, wallet signups, and story sharing.

In short, we help grow the ecosystem by making it feel real, relevant, and worth talking about.
answers.question: Ecosystem Contribution: How does your project complement existing initiatives in the GoodDollar ecosystem rather than competing with them?

answers.answer: Yes

We’re building something that feels personal. This project is about more than just adoption, it's about helping people feel connected, included, and inspired to take part in Web3 through real stories they can relate to.
Our team reflects the communities we serve, diverse, creative, and deeply invested. We’ve got experience in storytelling, grassroots engagement, and Web3 strategy, and there’s already excitement from collaborators who want to join us in the accelerator. With the right support, we’re ready to make this meaningful, practical, and impactful from day one.

project.title: WEB3 IMPACT STORY LAB ACCELERATOR
project.description:
The H.E.R. DAO StoryLab Accelerator is a 6-week immersive experience where storytellers and developers team up to create powerful, human-centered stories that show how Web3, Universal Basic Income (UBI), and blockchain tools like GoodDollar and Celo are expanding financial inclusion in real communities. Participants explore the real-world impact of decentralized tech while building creative and technical skills in storytelling, blockchain, and digital strategy.

With support from the H.E.R. DAO network including marketing mentorship, public showcases, and community partnerships. Each project is designed to engage new audiences and grow GoodDollar’s user base through culturally relevant, emotionally resonant content.

As one of the most diverse and impact-driven DAOs in Web3, H.E.R. DAO brings access to untold stories from the Global South, deep trust within dev communities, and a proven ability to activate ecosystems. In a space where tech often feels inaccessible, stories are what make it real. 

Execution Plan & Ecosystem Integration:

- 6-week online accelerator with a cohort of creatives, developers, and marketers
- Weekly expert-led sessions on storytelling, Web3 tools, and growth strategy
- Mentorship and ongoing support from the H.E.R. DAO community
- Cohort teams co-create storytelling-based campaigns around GoodDollar’s impact and utility
- Final deliverables include media assets (videos, campaigns, articles, etc.) optimized for community resonance, virality, and growth

This project is designed to meet the Marketing & Growth Hacking track while integrating with the GoodDollar ecosystem through real-world stories showcasing G$ token use, protocol education, and ecosystem adoption. The final showcase and media assets will support broader community onboarding and GoodDollar utility awareness, especially across emerging markets.

This accelerator offers a creative, and scalable approach to marketing helping GoodDollar drive growth, boost visibility, and build long-term community engagement through the power of story.

Hack Africa is designed to amplify—not compete with—GoodDollar’s mission of financial inclusion through Good dollar hackathons. Here’s how we align with and strengthen existing initiatives:

1. Expanding Developer Adoption (No Overlap with GoodDollar’s Core Product)

GoodDollar’s Focus: Onboarding end-users (e.g., unbanked populations) via wallets and G$ distribution.

Hack Africa’s Role:

Educates developers on leveraging and using G$ into dApps (e.g., DeFi, DAOs, gig economy tools).

Creates new use cases (e.g., G$ as collateral for microloans) that drive demand for the protocol.

Complements GoodDollar’s tech team by stress-testing APIs/SDKs in hackathons.

Synergy: More builders = more innovative G$ applications = more end-users.


2. Strengthening Community-Led Growth (DAO Alignment)
GoodDollar’s Focus: Decentralizing governance via community votes.

Hack Africa’s Role:

Onboards African devs into GoodDollar’s and celo DAO by training them on governance participation.

Proposes funding for G$ projects (e.g., via Engagement Rewards).

Does not compete for resources—instead, we channel hackathon winners to GoodDollar’s grant programs.

Synergy: A larger, more engaged DAO with African representation.

project.title: Hack Africa
project.description:
Hack Africa is a leading platform that brings together developers, designers, entrepreneurs, and Web3 enthusiasts across Africa to collaborate, innovate, and compete in hackathons. With a strong focus on blockchain, decentralized applications (dApps), and the Web3 ecosystem, Hack Africa serves as a launchpad for the next generation of African digital innovators.

Key Features of Hack Africa:

1. Web3 & Blockchain-Focused Hackathons
Hack Africa hosts Web3-themed hackathons, encouraging builders to create decentralized solutions for real-world challenges.

Common tracks include:

DeFi (Decentralized Finance) – Solutions for financial inclusion, lending, and payments.

NFTs & Digital Ownership – Projects around art, gaming, and identity verification.

DAOs (Decentralized Autonomous Organizations) – Tools for community governance.

Blockchain for Social Impact – Transparency in supply chains, voting, and charity.

2. A Thriving Web3 Builder Community
Connects African developers with global blockchain experts, investors, and mentors.
Provides networking opportunities with Ethereum, Solana, Polygon, and other blockchain ecosystems.
Features AMA (Ask Me Anything) sessions, workshops, and coding bootcamps on smart contracts, Rust, Solidity, and more.

3. Prizes, Grants & Investor Access
Winning teams receive cash prizes, crypto grants, and incubation opportunities.

Top projects may secure funding from Web3 VCs, accelerators, or blockchain foundations.
Some hackathons offer token grants, cloud credits (from AWS, Google Cloud), and developer tools.

4. Partnerships with Major Web3 Players
Collaborates with Ethereum , Layer 2s such as Celo and other leading blockchain organizations.
Corporate sponsors include tech giants, African fintech firms, and crypto startups looking for talent and innovation.

5. Real-World Impact Through Decentralized Tech
Encourages solutions for African challenges like remittances, land registry, identity verification, and transparent governance using blockchain.

Past projects have included DeFi platforms for cross-border payments, NFT marketplaces for African artists, and DAOs for community funding.

Why Join Hack Africa?
✅ Break into Web3 – Learn blockchain development and build a portfolio.
✅ Meet Industry Leaders – Network with top Web3 founders and investors.
✅ Win Crypto & Funding – Get grants, tokens, and startup support.
✅ Solve Local Problems with Global Tech – Build dApps that matter for Africa.

How to Get Involved

As a Builder: Join hackathons by signing up on Hack Africa’s website. Follow our socials to 
As a Sponsor/Partner: Web3 projects can support hackathons to find talent and innovative dApps.
As a Mentor/Judge: Blockchain experts can guide the next wave of African Web3 developers.
Success Stories

answers.answer: Web3 Certifier is a blockchain-based examination platform. The users that pass the examinations get NFT certificates. The examinations are multiple-choice questions with 4 possible answers. The exam process is done in 4 steps:     1. Certifier creates exam with questions.     2. Users submit answers to the exam.     3. After examination end the certifier has 5 minutes to correct the exam by providing the answers.     4. If the user has passed the exam, they can claim their NFT certificate. Also, there is an AI Agent running on Discord that can recommend an exam based on users' interests or summarize the skills of a user based on their certifications. For more info reach out on discord (my username: "elamore_").
answers.question: Project Description: Briefly describe your project and how it enhances G$ utility or adoption

project.title: Web3 Certifier
project.description:
## What is it?
Web3 Certifier is a blockchain-based examination platform. The users that pass the examinations get NFT certificates. The examinations are multiple-choice questions with 4 possible answers. The exam process is done in 4 steps:
    1. Certifier creates exam with questions.
    2. Users submit answers to the exam.
    3. After examination end the certifier has 5 minutes to correct the exam by providing the answers.
    4. If the user has passed the exam, they can claim their NFT certificate.
Also, there is an AI Agent running on Discord that can recommend an exam based on users' interests or summarize the skills of a user based on their certifications. For more info reach out on discord (my username: "elamore_").

## GoodDollar Identity
I need to use the GoodDollar unique identity system so that I can make a type of exam that is only for real users and only allows each user to submit once. That way certifiers can create exams that check if the user that submits the answers is real or not while preventing multiple submission attempts from different accounts of the same user. Also, I would love to deploy on Celo due to its beginner friendly features and its strong momentum. The implementation of the identity system will be done using the "gooddollar/web3sdk-v2" library.

## Team
Right now the team consists only by me, Spyros. I am a blockchain developer and also have experience in full-stack development. You can see my previous projects on my github: https://github.com/spyros-zikos?tab=repositories.
Some of them are:
    1. AUTODAO (https://ethglobal.com/showcase/auto-dao-t0und)
    In this project my team won 2 prizes in the ETHGlobal hackathon. I mostly developed the frontend and did the DIMO integration.
    2. Bonding Curve Presale (https://github.com/spyros-zikos/Bonding-Curve-Presale)
    This is a project I developed for a company named White Had DAO which wanted to launch a new product and wanted me do build their smart contracts.
    3. Tip This Creator (https://github.com/spyros-zikos/tip-this-creator)
    I developed this project during the Agentic Ethereum ETHGlobal hackathon. It is an AI agent that helps twitter users tip their favorite content creators using crypto.

## Milestones
Milestone 1 - Until 30/04: Smart contract developement and testing.
Milestone 2 - Until 30/07: Unique identity system integration and front-end developement.
Milestone 3 - Until 30/10: Deploy to Celo and get funding to do marketing and BD.
Milestone 4 - Until 30/12: Get 10k paying users.

## Growth Strategy
I think that initially the main driver of traffic will be from partnerships with web3 educational platforms or web3 creators. These partners will be able to better monetize their content while also engaging with their audience more effectively. After gaining some users and revenue we can attract more people and host a wider variety of examination subjects and certificates by advertising and partnering with educators of any subject.

## Funding Needed (Estimates)
Estimated min and max amounts per milestone.
For milestone 1, max: $3k, min: $2k
For milestone 2, max: $5k, min: $2k
For milestone 3, max: $5k, min: $200
For milestone 4, max: $5k, min: $0

## Competition
I am not aware of any other projects in the GoodDollar ecosystem that would be considered as competitors. I believe Web3 Certifier will be a unique platform that will attract many educators to the Celo chain and the GoodDollar ecosystem that want to create certifications for their audience. This project is aligned with the GoodDollar ecosystem because its goal is to make education universally available.

project.title: PollPal
project.description: PollPal is a decentralized platform for creating and participating in community-driven polls. Built on blockchain technology, it ensures secure, transparent, and fair voting. To further empower our community and support project growth, PollPal integrates the $G token from the GoodDollar ecosystem. We will utilize $G tokens as a form of grant distribution to reward active participants, poll creators, and contribute to the ongoing development of the platform. This aligns with GoodDollar's vision of fostering a 'trickle-up' value structure, directly benefiting those who contribute to and utilize PollPal. By leveraging the $G token, we aim to incentivize community participation, promote decentralized governance, and build a sustainable platform for collective decision-making.

answers.answer: The project focuses on launching a community recycling initiative that utilizes cUSD rewards to promote sustainable practices. By integrating this initiative with the Good Dollar (G$) ecosystem, we enhance its utility by providing users with direct incentives for eco-friendly behaviors. Participants will also earn $G through recycling, which can be easily spent within the G$ framework, fostering engagement and encouraging wider adoption. Additionally, partnerships with local businesses and platforms like Bitgify and Minipay facilitate seamless transactions, creating a vibrant ecosystem that not only supports sustainability but also strengthens the Good Dollar community by driving participation and social responsibility.
answers.question: Project Description: Briefly describe your project and how it enhances G$ utility or adoption

answers.answer:
Technical Implementation
Approach:
The project will create a decentralized application (dApp) on blockchain to promote recycling through cUSD rewards. Key components include:

Smart Contracts: Manage cUSD distribution based on recycling participation.
User Interface: Develop a user-friendly platform for tracking contributions and rewards.
Integration with GoodDollar: Utilize the GoodDollar API for seamless reward transfers into the G$ ecosystem.
Partnerships: Collaborate with local businesses to enable reward redemption.
Implementation Plan for New Builders
Research: Understand the GoodDollar ecosystem and identify local partners.
Development: Set up a blockchain environment, develop smart contracts, and create the front-end application.
Testing: Test smart contracts on a testnet and gather user feedback on the dApp.
Deployment: Launch the smart contracts and dApp.
Monitoring: Track user engagement and refine features based on feedback.
Community Engagement: Promote the initiative through workshops and social media.
This plan enables effective integration with GoodDollar, fostering sustainability and community involvement.

answers.answer:
User Adoption Strategy
To attract users to our project and drive GoodDollar (G$) adoption, we will implement the following strategies:

Incentive-Based Engagement:
Reward System: Users earn cUSD for participating in recycling activities, which can be easily converted to G$. This direct incentive will encourage initial participation.
Referral Program: Implement a referral system where existing users earn additional rewards for bringing new users into the platform.
Community Building:
Local Events: Host community recycling events and workshops to raise awareness about sustainability and the benefits of G$.
Social Media Campaigns: Utilize platforms like Instagram and Twitter to share success stories, user testimonials, and educational content related to recycling and G$.
Partnerships:
Collaborate with Local Businesses: Partner with local eco-friendly businesses to offer discounts or services in exchange for cUSD, creating a tangible value for users.
Engage Nonprofits: Work with environmental organizations to promote our initiative, leveraging their networks to reach a broader audience.
User Experience Optimization:
Seamless Onboarding: Ensure a smooth onboarding process with clear instructions and support to help new users understand how to participate and earn rewards.
Feedback Loop: Regularly collect user feedback to improve the platform and address any pain points.
Metrics for Success:
User Growth Rate: Track the increase in active users on the platform monthly.
Engagement Levels: Monitor the frequency of recycling activities and reward claims.
Referral Tracking: Measure the number of new users acquired through referrals.
Community Event Attendance: Evaluate participation in local events and workshops to gauge interest and engagement.
By implementing these strategies, we aim to create a vibrant community around our recycling initiative that not only promotes sustainable practices but also encourages the adoption of GoodDollar.

answers.answer:
Funding Allocation
To maximize impact, the funding will be allocated across key areas as follows:

Development (40%)
Smart Contract Development: 20% for building and testing smart contracts.
dApp User Interface: 20% for designing and implementing a user-friendly interface.
Marketing and Community Engagement (30%)
Incentive Programs: 15% for rewards and referral bonuses to attract users.
Community Events: 10% for organizing workshops and local recycling events.
Social Media Campaigns: 5% for promoting the initiative and G$ adoption.
Partnerships (20%)
Local Business Collaborations: 10% to establish partnerships that offer discounts and services for cUSD.
Nonprofit Engagement: 10% for collaborating with environmental organizations to expand reach.
Operations and Support (10%)
User Support Services: 5% for customer support and user education.
Administrative Costs: 5% for operational expenses, including platform maintenance.
This allocation ensures a balanced approach, focusing on development, community engagement, and partnerships to maximize the impact of the project and drive GoodDollar adoption.
answers.question: Funding Allocation: How will you allocate the funding to maximize impact? Provide a simple breakdown of resource allocation.

answers.answer:
Ecosystem Contribution
Our project complements existing initiatives in the GoodDollar ecosystem in several key ways:

Enhancing User Engagement:
By offering cUSD rewards for recycling, we provide an additional incentive for users to participate actively in the GoodDollar ecosystem, thereby increasing overall engagement and usage.
Promoting Sustainability:
Our focus on environmental sustainability aligns with GoodDollar's mission of social impact. This initiative encourages eco-friendly behaviors, creating a positive feedback loop that benefits both the community and the ecosystem.
Facilitating Partnerships:
We will collaborate with local businesses and nonprofits, creating a network that enhances the value of GoodDollar. These partnerships can lead to more opportunities for users to spend their G$ and cUSD rewards, driving further adoption.
Education and Awareness:
Our community events and educational workshops will inform users about both recycling practices and the benefits of using GoodDollar. This knowledge sharing enhances the ecosystem by fostering a more informed user base.
Integration with Existing Platforms:
By utilizing the GoodDollar API, our project ensures seamless integration with the existing ecosystem, allowing users to easily transition between earning rewards and spending them within the GoodDollar framework.
Overall, our initiative acts as a complementary layer to the GoodDollar ecosystem, driving engagement and promoting shared values without competing with existing projects.

project.title: Carus Recycling
project.description:
Project Description: Carus Recycling Initiative
Overview
The Carus Recycling Initiative is a community-driven project aimed at transforming plastic waste management through innovative technology and engagement strategies. Our mission is to promote sustainable practices by making recycling accessible, rewarding, and efficient for everyone in the community.

Objectives
Increase Recycling Participation: By incentivizing recycling through reward systems, we aim to boost community involvement and reduce waste.
Enhance Accessibility: Providing multiple drop-off locations and convenient pick-up options to ensure that recycling is easy and hassle-free for all residents.
Educate the Community: Offering educational resources that inform the public about the importance of recycling and sustainable practices.
Utilize Technology: Leveraging blockchain technology to track recycling efforts and ensure transparency in the process.
Key Features
Daily Claims and Rewards: Users can earn daily rewards for their recycling activities, encouraging consistent engagement.
Scheduled Pick-Ups: Residents can conveniently schedule pick-ups for their recyclable materials, making participation easier.
Drop-Off Locations: Multiple strategically located drop-off points throughout the community to accommodate various schedules and preferences.
Real-Time Support: Integration of Telegram support for instant assistance and updates, fostering community engagement.
Community Impact
The Carus Recycling Initiative is designed to create a positive environmental impact by reducing plastic waste in landfills and promoting a culture of sustainability. By empowering individuals to take action, we aim to foster a sense of community responsibility and awareness regarding environmental issues.

Conclusion
Through the Carus Recycling Initiative, we strive to build a greener future by transforming how our community approaches recycling. With innovative features, educational resources, and a commitment to accessibility, we are dedicated to making recycling a seamless and rewarding experience for everyone. Together, we can create a cleaner, more sustainable environment.

answers.answer: We are building a dApp that gamifies capital allocation for the GoodDollar Ecosystem, uniting communities to support community efforts that drive its growth and impact.  50% of this grant will be sent directly to empower community members by funding four dedicated pools (tracks) for anyone eager to strengthen the ecosystem.
answers.question: Project Description: Briefly describe your project and how it enhances G$ utility or adoption

answers.answer:
We will leverage the Superfluid Protocol and the G$ super token to continuously stream funds, opening the "floodgates" of our main Fountain and dynamically distributing resources to each dedicated pool and its members in real time.

Thanks to this fluid capital allocation system, we can constantly adjust flow rates and percentages to reflect community performance, sentiment and evolving needs, ensuring a funding model that it’s transparent, flexible, and continuously evolving.

3-Create a pilot of the Infinite Fountain Distribution Pools in Superfluid, with at least 100 recipients. (3 months).

*For these milestones we are calculating a $1,500 grant. As Gitcoin rounds are unpredictable, we will adjust these milestones up or down accordingly.

We are here for the long-term, so we want to use this first grant to test our ideas and then apply to the next phases of the GoodBuilders Program.

project.title: Good Dollar’s Infinite Fountain
project.description:
**Good Dollar’s Infinite Fountain (by ForkinWisdom)**  Gamifying GoodDollar’s Ecosystem and Community Growth

\-

We are building a dApp that gamifies capital allocation for the GoodDollar Ecosystem, uniting communities to support community efforts that drive its growth and impact.

**50% of this grant** will be sent directly to empower community members by funding four dedicated pools (tracks) for anyone eager to strengthen the ecosystem.

\-

Here are some [VideoWalkthroughs](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1GbDrTOUCBhsNIOXklaYvnqmExk85aX-GGC-yqd4iKXs/edit?usp=sharing) of the dApp (WIP)

\-

We will create 4 strategic pools (tracks):

**Mutual Aid, Cooperatives, and Micro-Credit:**  
This track empowers grassroots initiatives by providing financial support and resources for community-based aid, cooperative projects, and micro-credit programs—all designed to strengthen local economies within the GoodDollar Ecosystem.

**Marketplace Booster:**  
Focused on driving economic activity, this pool incentivizes users to buy, sell, and exchange services with the G$ token, creating a self-sustaining marketplace that enhances token utility and fosters vibrant commercial interactions.

**Community Onboarding:**  
This track accelerates ecosystem growth by encouraging new users to join GoodDollar. It offers incentives for buying G$ tokens, exploring the diverse tools, and actively engaging in the community, ensuring a seamless and welcoming introduction to the platform.

**Marketing and Meme Culture:**  
Harnessing the power of creative content and community-driven promotion, this pool leverages innovative marketing strategies and meme culture to boost brand visibility, engage a broader audience, and drive the overall adoption of GoodDollar.

\-

We will leverage the Superfluid Protocol and the G$ super token to continuously stream funds, opening the "floodgates" of our main Fountain and dynamically distributing resources to each dedicated pool and its members in real time.

Thanks to this fluid capital allocation system, we can constantly adjust flow rates and percentages to reflect community performance, sentiment and evolving needs, ensuring a funding model that it’s transparent, flexible, and continuously evolving.

To further energize participation, every pool will feature an engaging leaderboard that gamifies the experience and encourages participants to excel in their contributions, earn competitive rewards, and drive the overall success of their pool.

\-

**But why do we use the word “Infinite” ?**

Traditional funding models that rely solely on one-off giveaways lack sustainability and fail to deliver any real return on investment. In our approach, each pool is designed with clear KPIs focused on generating ROI, ensuring that every initiative not only sustains itself but also adds value back to the main pool.

By reinvesting returns into the Infinite Fountain, we create a perpetual funding cycle that drives growth and encourages a mindset of sustainable investment. This model transforms funding into a renewable endeavor—one that continually strengthens the GoodDollar Ecosystem while ensuring that resources are consistently reinvested and never exhausted.

answers.answer: CeloSubPay is a decentralized subscription payment protocol designed to enable automated recurring payments using stablecoins like cUSD and cEUR on the Celo blockchain. By integrating with GoodDollar (G$), CeloSubPay can provide seamless, low-cost subscription services where users can authorize recurring payments in G$, expanding its utility. This allows microtransactions and financial inclusion for unbanked users globally, aligning with GoodDollar’s mission of democratizing access to decentralized finance.
answers.question: Project Description: Briefly describe your project and how it enhances G$ utility or adoption

answers.answer:
CeloSubPay will integrate GoodDollar (G$) as a payment option for subscription-based services. The implementation will involve:

Smart Contract Development – Deploying subscription management contracts that support recurring payments in G$.

GoodDollar Integration – Enabling payments via G$ using smart contracts that interact with the GoodDollar reserve and staking mechanisms.

AI-driven Credit Risk Assessment – Implementing machine learning models to analyze user transaction history and ensure optimal payment efficiency.

User Dashboard & Merchant Portal – Developing a React-based UI with shadcn/ui & Tailwind CSS for subscribers and merchants to manage payments.

Mobile-First Accessibility – Leveraging Celo’s mobile-first approach to ensure ease of use for low-income populations.
answers.question: Technical Implementation: Describe your approach and how it integrates with GoodDollar. For new builders, outline your implementation plan.

answers.answer:
Our team brings deep expertise in Web3, DeFi, and blockchain development, with a strong track record in the Celo ecosystem and beyond.

Nasihudeen Jimoh(Founder)– A seasoned full-stack blockchain developer with extensive experience in DeFi, ReFi, and real-world asset (RWA) tokenization. He has participated in multiple Celo hackathons and actively contributes to the Celo and ReFi communities.

GitHub: https://github.com/Kanasjnr

Twitter: https://x.com/KanasJnr

LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/nasihudeen-jimoh/

Our smart contract engineers specialize in Solidity, smart contract security, and decentralized payment protocols, ensuring robust and scalable blockchain solutions.

Our frontend and backend engineers have expertise in React, Node.js, and TypeScript, building seamless and user-friendly interfaces for Web3 applications.

We are supported by advisors from the Celo and ReFi ecosystem, providing strategic guidance to align CeloSubPay with GoodDollar’s mission and drive adoption within the ecosystem.

answers.answer:
(Month 1) Smart Contract Development: Build and test the subscription management contracts supporting G$.

(Month 2) GoodDollar Integration: Enable G$ transactions and test on Celo testnet.

(Month 3) AI-Based Credit Risk System: Develop and deploy initial ML models for payment risk assessment.

(Month 4) UI & Merchant Dashboard: Launch the frontend for user subscriptions and merchant onboarding.

(Month 5) Public Beta & User Testing: Deploy on Celo mainnet and onboard the first set of merchants.

project.title: SubPay
project.description: SubPay is a decentralized finance (DeFi) protocol  that enables automated, recurring subscription payments using stablecoins. The protocol creates a bridge between the traditional subscription economy and blockchain technology, allowing businesses to offer subscription services while giving users full control over their payment authorizations. SubPay leverages artificial intelligence for credit risk assessment, fraud detection, and payment optimization, creating a robust ecosystem for recurring payments in the Web3 space.  The system enables businesses to create flexible subscription models (monthly, quarterly, annual) with automated billing while providing subscribers with transparent, user-controlled payment experiences. By eliminating intermediaries and utilizing stablecoins SubPay reduces costs, increases efficiency, and expands access to subscription-based services globally.

answers.answer: IYKYK DAO is a culture-first public goods collective building an onchain memecoin ecosystem to support regenerative finance. Our launch includes a Juicebox-powered token ($IYKYK) and a phased liquidity strategy that allocates ETH and governance to mission-aligned ecosystems like GoodDollar.  Through this grant, we’ll strengthen the utility of G$ by seeding G$/ETH liquidity, contributing to the G$ treasury, and aligning governance incentives. Our goal is to make UBI culture viral, fundable, and creatively valuable.
answers.question: Project Description: Briefly describe your project and how it enhances G$ utility or adoption

answers.answer:
✅ Technical Implementation

We’ll launch the $IYKYK token & community NFT series via Juicebox. 5–10% of raised ETH will be routed to:

G$/ETH liquidity on Uniswap (Base)

Direct G$ treasury contributions

Funds will be held and managed via a Gnosis Safe. We’ll implement governance boosts for LP stakers in a later phase and track participation via Guild.xyz + Snapshot.
answers.question: Technical Implementation: Describe your approach and how it integrates with GoodDollar. For new builders, outline your implementation plan.

answers.answer:
Our team consists of artists, memers, and DAO-native contributors with experience in:

Juicebox & Snapshot DAO setups

Campaigns on Farcaster, Twitter, Instagram, Substack, Etc

DeFi onboarding + creative bounties
We’re working closely with the Base ecosystem and aligning with Optimism and Celo through a phased roadmap.
answers.question: Team Capability: Highlight your team's relevant experience and past delivery of similar projects, particularly in the Web3 space or with GoodDollar. Please add relevant links to members GitHub, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc as needed.

answers.answer:
Phase 1 (May - July 2025): Foundation & Community Launch

Launch a community NFT series via Juicebox to kick off IYKYK DAO's funding and onboarding.

Use NFT mint proceeds to fund the initial buy-in of the $IYKYK token and establish treasury liquidity.

Allocate 2–5% of all NFT mint revenue to the GoodDollar Treasury to align publicly with public goods.

Begin onboarding campaigns via Discord, Farcaster, and Guild.xyz — with roles and missions for contributors and G$ holders.

Publish our public goods mission through the first issue of the IYKYK digital magazine and seed its distribution.

Phase 2 (July - Sept 2025): Liquidity, Governance & Collaboration

Explore and deploy G$ liquidity mechanisms, including:

ETH → G$ liquidity pools on Base

IYKYK → G$ experimental pools for governance-boosting rewards

Launch public goods content bounty program: fund creators to produce G$ and UBI-aligned content for minting via Zora.

Initiate Zora drops tied to magazine themes, memes, and public goods content.

Roll out governance booster features: grant proposal power or voting multipliers to G$/LP holders.

Begin outreach and co-creation with aligned NFT brands, ReFi collectives, and local publication partners.
answers.question: Roadmap & Milestones: Outline 3-5 key milestones with timeframes demonstrating how you'll deliver value to the GoodDollar ecosystem.

answers.answer:
We’ll attract users by:

Launching Guild.xyz quests gated by G$ holdings

Distributing $IYKYK to verified G$ claimers (optional allowlist)

Meme campaigns on Farcaster, Twitter, and Warpcast

Collaborations with artists and GoodDollar community members

Strategic partnerships with major NFT brands like Lazy Lions and World of Women

Distribution of our IYKYK digital/print magazine, expanding to the top 5 US cities as part of a national public goods media campaign
answers.question: User Adoption Strategy: How will you attract users to your project and drive G$ adoption? Include specific strategies or metrics. You can find more details on the engagement rewards to support this at: https://engagement-rewards.vercel.app/

answers.answer:
To maximize the impact of the GoodDollar grant, we will strategically deploy the received G$ to deepen liquidity, raise awareness, and support onboarding across both ecosystems:

50% — Incentivized Engagement & EducationWe will use this to fund meme campaigns, creative bounties, and quest rewards that introduce new users to both IYKYK and GoodDollar. This includes cross-platform content, Farcaster-native threads, and Guild.xyz quests.

25% — G$ Liquidity IncentivesA portion of the grant will be used to seed or match liquidity in G$/ETH or G$/IYKYK pools. This ensures that G$ remains tradable and increasingly useful across onchain markets.

15% — G$ Claimant Airdrop & Role AccessWe’ll use part of the G$ grant to airdrop tokens to existing GoodDollar users and grant them access to exclusive roles, tools, and DAO spaces — strengthening our shared ecosystem.

10% — Operations & Campaign ToolsCovers setup and support infrastructure such as DAO tools, integrations, creative production, and magazine placement related to the campaign.
answers.question: Funding Allocation: How will you allocate the funding to maximize impact? Provide a simple breakdown of resource allocation.

answers.answer:
Contribute meaningful liquidity to the G$ economy through LP seeding and experimental pairings

Incentivize participation in G$ with creative onchain rewards and meme-native experiences

Support the growth of G$ through direct treasury contributions and narrative framing

Enhance the visibility of G$ among creator communities and Web3-native cultural groups

Extend GoodDollar’s reach into both physical and digital spaces via the IYKYK magazine, distributed in top US cities and onchain.

answers.answer: Yes

answers.answer:
This grant represents a unique convergence of cultural storytelling, regenerative incentives, and grassroots participation

We aim to position IYKYK as a DAO-native cultural platform that creates real-world and onchain impact

Funding from GoodDollar will not only support these goals but also demonstrate a scalable model for how public goods protocols can collaborate with memecoin DAOs to achieve mutual growth and visibility
