answers.answer: Our project, GoodMarket, is an innovative platform designed to boost the adoption and utility of G$ within the GoodDollar ecosystem. GoodMarket connects G$ holders with merchants and service providers who accept G$ as a form of payment, offering a seamless and user-friendly experience for users to spend their G$ on various goods and services.  By creating a marketplace that promotes G$ as a viable currency, GoodMarket encourages users to actively engage with the GoodDollar ecosystem and explore the real-world applications of G$. Additionally, GoodMarket fosters an inclusive environment for businesses and individuals to benefit from the universal basic income provided by GoodDollar, strengthening the ecosystem and driving wider adoption of G$.  In summary, GoodMarket enhances G$ adoption and utility by offering a practical and accessible way for users to spend their G$ on a diverse range of products and services, while also increasing visibility and acceptance of G$ among merchants and service providers.
answers.question: Project Description: Briefly describe your project and how it enhances G$ utility or adoption

answers.answer:
Our technical approach for GoodMarket focuses on building a user-friendly platform that integrates seamlessly with the GoodDollar ecosystem. To achieve this, we will:

Integrate GoodDollar Wallet: Users will be able to connect their GoodDollar wallets to our platform, allowing them to view their G$ balances and make transactions on GoodMarket effortlessly. We will utilize the GoodDollar API to facilitate secure and reliable communication between our platform and users' GoodDollar wallets.

Implement Merchant Onboarding: We will develop a streamlined process for merchants to join the platform and start accepting G$. This process will include verification, account setup, and integration of G$ payment gateway for their online stores.

Build a Searchable Marketplace: Our platform will feature a searchable marketplace where users can easily find and access goods and services offered by various merchants. We will implement advanced search filters to help users discover new options and explore the full potential of spending their G$.

Develop G$ Payment Gateway: 
A dedicated G$ payment gateway will be developed, enabling users to make purchases using G$ at participating merchants' online stores. This gateway will be designed with security and ease of use in mind, ensuring a smooth and seamless checkout process for both customers and merchants.

Establish a Robust Backend Infrastructure: We will utilize scalable and secure backend technologies to ensure high performance and data protection for our users and merchants.

In summary, our technical implementation focuses on delivering a user-friendly platform that integrates directly with GoodDollar, offering a seamless experience for users to spend their G$ on goods and services while expanding the acceptance of G$ among merchants.
answers.question: Technical Implementation: Describe your approach and how it integrates with GoodDollar. For new builders, outline your implementation plan.

answers.answer:
Our team, the GoodDollar Moderator Team, has a wealth of experience in managing and fostering the growth of the GoodDollar community. While we may not have direct experience in building a Web3 project from scratch, our extensive knowledge of the GoodDollar ecosystem and our strong commitment to its success make us the ideal candidates to bring GoodMarket to fruition.

As the GoodDollar Moderator Team, we have demonstrated our dedication to the project's success and our ability to drive community engagement and growth. With the support of the GoodBuilders program, we are confident that we can translate our expertise and passion into the successful development of GoodMarket.

Relevant link: https://x.com/GoodDollarTeam?s=09
answers.question: Team Capability: Highlight your team's relevant experience and past delivery of similar projects, particularly in the Web3 space or with GoodDollar. Please add relevant links to members GitHub, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc as needed.

answers.answer:
Our roadmap for GoodMarket is designed to ensure timely delivery of a functional platform that offers value to the GoodDollar ecosystem. Here are 3-5 key milestones with estimated timeframes:

🔸Milestone 1 (Month 1-2): -Project Planning and Design
Finalize project requirements and design 
-Create a detailed development plan 
-Set up development environment and infrastructure

🔸Milestone 2 (Month 2-4): -Platform Development and Integration
-Develop and test the user interface for the marketplace and user profiles
-Integrate GoodDollar wallet functionality for users and merchants
-Implement merchant onboarding process and back-end infrastructure
-Develop and test the G$ payment gateway

🔸Milestone 3 (Month 4-6): -Testing, Optimization, and Beta Launch
-Conduct thorough testing and debugging of all platform functionalities
-Gather feedback from initial users and merchants, and implement necessary improvements
-Launch the beta version of GoodMarket, with a limited number of users and merchants
Monitor platform performance and address any issues

🔸Milestone 4 (Month 6-8): Full Public Launch and Post-Launch -Support Officially launch GoodMarket to the wider GoodDollar community
-Conduct ongoing user and merchant support, ensuring a smooth experience
-Continuously gather feedback and implement updates to enhance the platform's functionality and usability
-Develop and roll out new features based on community needs and requests

Our roadmap is designed to ensure that GoodMarket is developed in a timely and efficient manner, with a focus on delivering value to the GoodDollar ecosystem through a user-friendly and inclusive marketplace platform. We will continually assess our progress and adjust our timeline as needed to achieve the desired outcomes for GoodMarket.
answers.question: Roadmap & Milestones: Outline 3-5 key milestones with timeframes demonstrating how you'll deliver value to the GoodDollar ecosystem.

answers.answer:
Our user adoption strategy for GoodMarket focuses on both attracting users to our platform and increasing overall GoodDollar adoption. Here are some specific strategies and metrics we plan to implement:

1. Community Engagement and Education:
-Leverage existing GoodDollar community channels (Telegram, Discord, etc.) to raise awareness about GoodMarket and its benefits.
-Collaborate with GoodDollar team and influencers to promote GoodMarket through social media, webinars, and community events.
-Develop educational content and resources to help users understand the value of using G$ for transactions on GoodMarket.
-Metrics: Community engagement rates, event attendance, social media reach, and content views/shares.

2. Merchant Onboarding:
-Strategically partner with a diverse range of merchants offering goods and services that appeal to the GoodDollar community.
-Provide onboarding support and resources to help merchants seamlessly integrate with GoodMarket and accept G$ payments.
-Metrics: Number of merchants onboarded, transaction volume, and merchant satisfaction rates.

3. Incentivized Referral Programs:
-Implement a referral program that rewards users for inviting friends and family to join GoodMarket and make G$ transactions.
-Offer promotional discounts and bonuses for first-time users and merchants to encourage initial adoption.
-Metrics: Referral sign-ups, user retention rates, and promotional offer redemption rates.

4. Collaboration with Other Web3 Projects:
-Explore partnerships with other Web3 projects and communities to cross-promote GoodMarket and the use of G$.
-Identify opportunities for integration with other blockchain-based platforms or tools to expand the reach of GoodMarket.
-Metrics: Number of partnerships, integration points, and user engagement from partner communities.

By implementing these strategies and tracking relevant metrics, we aim to drive adoption of GoodMarket and contribute to the growth of the GoodDollar ecosystem as a whole.
answers.question: User Adoption Strategy: How will you attract users to your project and drive G$ adoption? Include specific strategies or metrics. You can find more details on the engagement rewards to support this at: https://engagement-rewards.vercel.app/

answers.answer:
We understand the importance of allocating funding effectively to ensure the successful development and adoption of GoodMarket. Here's a simple breakdown of how we plan to allocate funding to maximize impact:

1. Development and -Infrastructure (40%):
Platform development and design
-Integration with GoodDollar wallet and deployment of G$ payment gateway
-Infrastructure setup and maintenance

2. Marketing and Community Outreach (25%):
-Educational content creation and promotion
-Social media campaigns and community events
-Collaboration with influencers and partners

3. Merchant Onboarding and Support (20%):
-Resources and support for merchant integration
-Onboarding process streamlining and optimization
-Partnership development with key merchants and service providers

4. User Adoption and Incentive Programs (10%):
-Implementation and management of referral programs and promotional offers
-User retention strategies and analytics

5. Reserves and Contingency (5%):
-Unexpected expenses or challenges
-Buffer for potential adjustments in development or marketing strategies

This funding allocation is designed to prioritize key aspects of the GoodMarket platform while maintaining flexibility to respond to any unforeseen challenges or opportunities that may arise during development and adoption. We believe this approach will help us maximize the impact of our efforts and contribute to the overall success of the GoodDollar ecosystem.
answers.question: Funding Allocation: How will you allocate the funding to maximize impact? Provide a simple breakdown of resource allocation.

answers.answer:
GoodMarket is designed to complement and enhance existing initiatives within the GoodDollar Ecosystem by providing a platform for users to leverage their G$ in a practical, real-world setting. Rather than competing with other initiatives, GoodMarket serves as an extension and a natural next step in the GoodDollar user journey.
Here's how GoodMarket complements existing initiatives:

1. GoodDollar Distribution and Education: GoodMarket provides a use case for the G$ tokens that users receive through the GoodDollar distribution mechanism. By offering a platform where users can spend their G$, GoodMarket increases the utility and relevance of the GoodDollar concept, supporting the adoption and understanding of UBI.

2. Community Engagement: Existing community engagement initiatives, such as events and social media campaigns, help create awareness and build interest in GoodDollar. GoodMarket complements these efforts by providing an additional touchpoint for users to actively engage with the GoodDollar ecosystem, fostering stronger connections and participation within the community.

3. Partnership and Integration: GoodMarket's focus on merchant partnerships and integrations further strengthens the GoodDollar ecosystem by creating more opportunities for collaboration with external businesses and projects. This complements existing partnerships by expanding the network of collaborators working together to support the growth and adoption of GoodDollar.

In summary, GoodMarket is a natural extension of existing GoodDollar initiatives, providing a practical platform that enables users to experience the value and utility of G$ firsthand. By working in tandem with other initiatives, GoodMarket contributes to the overall growth, adoption, and impact of the GoodDollar Ecosystem.
answers.question: Ecosystem Contribution: How does your project complement existing initiatives in the GoodDollar ecosystem rather than competing with them?

answers.answer: Yes
answers.question: Ethical Compliance: Confirm you have read and will comply with the ethical standards outlined in the eligibility criteria.

answers.answer:
One additional aspect to consider when evaluating the GoodMarket project is its scalability and adaptability to future developments within the GoodDollar ecosystem and broader Web3 landscape.
To ensure long-term success and continued relevance, it's crucial that GoodMarket:

Scalable Infrastructure: The platform should be built with scalability in mind, allowing it to handle increased user adoption and transaction volumes as the GoodDollar community grows.

Adaptability to New Technologies and Partnerships: GoodMarket should be designed to easily integrate with new technologies, tools, and partners that emerge within the Web3 ecosystem, ensuring it stays up-to-date and relevant in a rapidly evolving space.

Regulatory Compliance: As the regulatory landscape surrounding cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology continues to evolve, GoodMarket must stay informed about compliance requirements and ensure that it operates within the legal framework of relevant jurisdictions.

User Feedback and Iterative Improvement: To maintain its value proposition and ensure continued user satisfaction, GoodMarket should incorporate mechanisms for gathering user feedback and implementing iterative improvements based on this feedback.
answers.question: Additional Info: Is there anything else critical for evaluating your project that wasn't covered in the questions above?

answers.answer: **Bitsave is a Savings protocol that allows everyday users to save in crypto without exposure to market volatility.**  Bitsave introduces ‘SaveFi’, a new on-chain savings model using user-owned smart contracts that help people—especially in underserved regions in African countries—build financial discipline with stable, goal-based savings.  **By integrating $G as a savings token on Bitsave**, we give G$ holders a secure, structured way to grow and manage their wealth. This integration expands $G utility from a basic UBI or spendable token into a **long-term savings vehicle**, encouraging users to treat G$ as a tool not only for daily expenses but for future planning.  **Key benefits for G$ adoption:**  - **New use case:** Introduces goal-based crypto saving for G$ holders. - **Wider exposure:** Bitsave users will be encouraged to save in G$, increasing awareness and adoption. - **Financial empowerment:** Especially for users in emerging markets, saving in G$ helps them escape inflation and build stability.  With this integration, G$ becomes more than a basic income token—it becomes a **savings safety net**.
answers.question: Project Description: Briefly describe your project and how it enhances G$ utility or adoption

answers.answer:
**Technical Implementation:**

Bitsave is built on EVM-compatible chains using Solidity smart contracts. Our architecture uses a **Parent-Child contract model**, where each user gets a personal savings contract tied directly to their wallet. This structure ensures funds remain non-custodial, secure, and private.

To integrate **GoodDollar ($G)** as a savings token, we will:

---

**1. Token Integration:**

- Add $G token support to our contract interface as a valid deposit asset
- Enable $G selection as a preferred stable token when creating savings plans

**2. Savings Plan Logic Extension:**

- Modify contract logic to support interest-free tokens like $G
- Implement seamless $G balance handling for recurring deposits, withdrawals, and penalties

**3. $G Smart Contract Interaction:**

- Ensure compliance with $G staking and withdrawal standards
- Explore integration with GoodStaking or GoodReserve contracts for additional features, pending $G team guidance.

**4. UI/UX Update:**

- Add $G balance display, plan creation, and savings goal tracking
- Integrate with wallets (like Fuse + GoodDollar) for seamless onboarding of existing $G users

**5. Testing and Audit:**

- Deploy and test $G support with the community.
- Submit implementation for $G community review and third-party audit
1. Marketing:
Run Merch campaigns for saving on $G
Carryout info educative marketing activities for $G savings

---

**Timeline Estimate for Integration (2–3 weeks):**

- Week 1: Smart contract modifications and front-end integration
- Week 2: Testing and quality assurance
- Week 3: Launch user onboarding campaign and awareness initiatives

answers.question: Team Capability: Highlight your team's relevant experience and past delivery of similar projects, particularly in the Web3 space or with GoodDollar. Please add relevant links to members GitHub, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc as needed.

answers.answer:
### **1st Milestone: $G Token Integration**

**Timeline:** Week 1 – Week 2

- Add $G token support to Bitsave’s smart contracts and front end
- Enable users to create savings plans using $G
- Ensure compatibility with GoodDollar wallet

**Impact:** Expands $G utility beyond daily transactions to long-term savings use case

---

### **2nd Milestone: Launch & User Onboarding Campaign**

**Timeline:** Week 3 – Week 4

- Launch a targeted onboarding campaign for 500+ GoodDollar users
- Collaborate with GoodDAO ambassadors and Fuse communities in Africa
- Host Twitter Spaces, community calls, and publish explainers (visual + video)

**Impact:** Onboards new users into the GoodDollar ecosystem via SaveFi use case

---

### **3rd Milestone: Education & Local Language Guides**

**Timeline:** Week 4 – Week 6

- Create simple, mobile-friendly educational content (PDFs, videos) on “How to Save $G with Bitsave”
- Translate into 2–3 African languages (e.g., Swahili, Yoruba, Igbo)
- Meet users in the market, local drivers, campaigns to local people, like we did here https://x.com/_karlagod/status/1854877185993056286?t=1nLyDgLUZ5IC7vEUOqO8iw&s=19

**Impact:** Lowers onboarding barrier and improves accessibility for grassroots users

---

### ✅ **Milestone 4: User Metrics Dashboard & Feedback Loop**

**Timeline:** Week 6 – Week 8

- Launch a live dashboard showing $G savings metrics on Bitsave (total savers, amount saved, etc.)
- Implement user feedback form to guide future improvements
- Share monthly progress with the GoodDAO

**Impact:** Transparency and data-driven iteration for community-led improvements

---

### **5th Milestone: Scale to 6,400 G$ Savers (which is just 10% of the Good Dao community in 181 countries)**

**Timeline:** Month 3 – Month 4

- Run continuous grassroots campaigns (online + offline) in African markets
- Partner with community organizations and $G ambassadors for reach
- Offer limited-time bonus points or NFT badges for savers using $G

**Impact:** Drives active usage and boosts real-world adoption of $G
answers.question: Roadmap & Milestones: Outline 3-5 key milestones with timeframes demonstrating how you'll deliver value to the GoodDollar ecosystem.

answers.answer:
Our goal is to introduce G$ as a long-term savings tool for users in emerging markets, turning basic income into stored, goal-based value. We’ll attract users and drive G$ adoption using community-led campaigns, behavior incentives, and real-world financial use cases.

### **🧩 1. Onboarding & Education Campaigns**

**Strategy:**

- Create **simple, step-by-step content** (videos, visuals,) teaching users how to set up a G$ savings plan with Bitsave.
- Run "**Save Your First G$**" workshops through WhatsApp, Telegram, and community Zoom calls.

**Metrics:**

- 500 G$ savers in first 30 days
- 3,000+ people reached through educational materials.

---

### **🎯 2. SaveFi Streaks & Leaderboards (Gamified Adoption)**

**Strategy:**

- Incentivize users to **top up their G$ savings weekly** with **SaveFi streak points**.
- Reward consistent savers with **G$ bonuses or GoodDollar community NFTs**.
- Use **public leaderboards** to drive friendly competition among savers.

**Metrics:**

- 1,000 streak participants within 60 days
- 80% of savers complete at least 3 weeks of recurring top-ups

---

### **🤝 3. Local GoodDollar Ambassadors & Partner Communities**

**Strategy:**

- Partner with **GoodDollar Ambassadors** and grassroots organizations already promoting G$ in their regions.
- Equip them with promotional kits and branded flyers to help new users save G$ using Bitsave.
- Host **co-branded local events** (e.g., SaveFi Days, market trainings).

**Metrics:**

- 5+ active community partners
- 2,000+ new G$ savers across offline/online outreach

---

### **🎁 4. Engagement Rewards Program**

We'll integrate with the **GoodDollar Engagement Rewards system** to reward users for:

- **Creating their first G$ savings plan**
- **Completing weekly top-ups**
- **Referring new savers**
- **Sharing SaveFi success stories or testimonials on social media**

We'll structure these rewards into **simple weekly missions**, such as:

> "Save 10 G$ for 3 weeks in a row and earn 25 bonus G$!"
> 

**Metrics:**

- 3,000+ mission completions in 90 days
- 200+ user-generated tweets or stories about saving G$

---

### **📈 5. Metrics & Reporting Dashboard**

To ensure transparency and track growth, we'll build and share a **live dashboard** showing:

- Total number of G$ savers
- Total G$ saved
- Top streak holders and referral statistics

---

### **Our 90-Day Target:**

- 🚀 5,000 G$ savings plans created
- 👥 3,000+ active savers
- 📲 10,000+ people reached through outreach and rewards
answers.question: User Adoption Strategy: How will you attract users to your project and drive G$ adoption? Include specific strategies or metrics. You can find more details on the engagement rewards to support this at: https://engagement-rewards.vercel.app/

answers.answer:
## User Education & Onboarding Materials – 25%

- Create multilingual explainer videos
- Design posters, WhatsApp learning packs & Telegram content
- Build simple savings guides tailored to first-time G$ users

## Incentives & Engagement Rewards – 30%
**Provide G$ token rewards for:**

- First-time savers
- Weekly savings top-ups
- Referrals
- SaveFi streaks
- Leaderboard achievements & testimonials

## Local Community Activations – 20%

- Host in-person events & savings workshops in G$-friendly regions
- Run local campaigns with ambassadors
- Provide Bitsave x GoodDollar merch, flyers, and refreshments

## Developer Integration & Dashboard – 15%
- Upgrade Bitsave smart contracts to support G$
- Build live dashboard showing:
- G$ savings activity
- Top savers
- Community engagement metrics

## Project Management & Reporting – 10%

- Track progress & coordinate implementation
- Share monthly impact reports & growth insights
answers.question: Funding Allocation: How will you allocate the funding to maximize impact? Provide a simple breakdown of resource allocation.

answers.answer:
Bitsave complements the GoodDollar ecosystem by introducing SaveFi—a simple, non-custodial way for users to save their G$ tokens over time, rather than just spend or earn them.

Here’s how Bitsave adds value without competing:

Extends Use Case:

While most GoodDollar dApps focus on daily utility (spending, tipping, microtasks), Bitsave introduces a new long-term behavior: saving for future needs.

This aligns with GoodDollar’s mission of economic empowerment by encouraging financial discipline among G$ earners.

Complements Existing Earning Apps:

Users earning G$ from dApps like GoodTask or Claim DApp can set aside a portion of their earnings into Bitsave savings plans.

It helps them build a savings habit and prevents impulsive spending.

Non-Custodial + Personal Contracts:

Bitsave doesn’t take custody of G$ tokens. Each user’s savings are stored in their own smart contract, preserving the decentralization and transparency GoodDollar values.

Gamified Savings + Leaderboards:

Bitsave introduces leaderboards, savings streaks, and referral bonuses that increase daily user engagement, amplifying the impact of GoodDollar's existing incentive programs.

Community-Led Education:

Bitsave’s focus on African markets complements GoodDollar’s community-first approach. We’ll run grassroots campaigns to educate users about both platforms—expanding the G$ footprint together.

project.title: Bitsave Protocol
project.description:
# WHAT IS BITSAVE?

Bitsave is a savings protocol that helps users save in Cryptocurrency without losing their savings to Market volatility.

# BITSAVE SOLUTION (simplified)

- Bitsave helps everyday people in African Countries escape inflation in their fiat currencies by saving in dollars.
- The dollar is not easily accessible to the average African through traditional banks, you have to go through many KYCed processes and get 
- Bitsave helps users create an automatic recurring savings plan with Stables.

**How Bitsave Works**  
[![save.png](https://i.postimg.cc/RFNQkQHG/save.png)](https://postimg.cc/gXbZRh46)

**1. Creating a Savings Plan and Secure Deposits**  
- Users initiate a savings plan by depositing funds in a stablecoin—not into a pooled DeFi protocol that might be vulnerable to hacks.  

- During plan creation, the user sets specific parameters, triggering the deployment of a child contract under the Bitsave Protocol Parent contract. 

This contract securely holds the deposited funds and is exclusively accessible via the user’s wallet.  
[![create-sav.png](https://i.postimg.cc/MT9RpcyH/create-sav.png)](https://postimg.cc/sQZ1ngHC)

- The Bitsave Parent-Child smartcontract design makes it such that each user's savings are directly tied to their wallet, so even in the event of a  protocol exploit, the hacker would need to get each users wallet private keys to access the funds. 
[![dur.png](https://i.postimg.cc/pXzSpx6x/dur.png)](https://postimg.cc/CzM72y06)

- Every user’s savings deposit is tied to their wallet so that in case of an exploit, the hacker wouldn’t have access to user funds, except they have access to users' wallet private keys, this minimises the risks of users losing their funds to exploits.


**2. Savings Plans and Fee Structure**  
- When creating a savings plan, users incur a one-time $1 or less, fee for creating the Savings contract.


**3. Break Savings Penalties**
Users set the penalty fee (1%–5% of their savings) when creating the plan. Users with bad savings habit who want to discipline them selves to save and discourage themselves from breaking their savings usually set the highest fee. If they break their savings early, the penalty is deducted.
[![pen.png](https://i.postimg.cc/V5P0vXHq/pen.png)](https://postimg.cc/FkGHnkvz)

**4. Multiple Savings Purpose and Naming**
Users can create multiple savings plans for different purposes and manage them on Bitsave; vacation, rent, school fees, emergencies etc.
[![sav.png](https://i.postimg.cc/wTt1JxKt/sav.png)](https://postimg.cc/N5cGvcjY)

**5. Top Up**
Bitsave Top-Up feature makes it easy, for users to create recurring savings for diferrent purposes; so if a user was saving for rent and they wanted to save $100 every month for 6 months, then all they need to do is create a Savings Plan for rent and top $100 every month.
[![top-up.png](https://i.postimg.cc/mrQrZD0M/top-up.png)](https://postimg.cc/rdwTQ8yF)

## SaveFi vs DeFi .....*Web3 Understands DeFi, Bitsave has introduced SaveFi.*

Globally, there are 4 popular players in Finance;
-Banks (Including Co-Operatives, Credit Unions, Brokerage firms etc)
-Centralized Exchanges
-DeFi
-SaveFI

SaveFi is Both Decentralized and Affordable because it focuses on savings and not investments.
[![savefi.png](https://i.postimg.cc/SK3t28Zj/savefi.png)](https://postimg.cc/4Kv1jKRT)

Savings and Investments aren't the same thing.
[![sa.png](https://i.postimg.cc/tCvwSnX5/sa.png)](https://postimg.cc/KRL04z3k)

- Savings prioritizes safety and availability of funds over interests.
- Investments prioritizes risks over safety of funds, for financial gain.

Bitsave Users are users who just want a tool that helps them keep money for the rainy days.

Bitsave users use Bitsave to save and not invest, they want to achieve their savings goals in the left side of this table👇🏽
[![sav-in.png](https://i.postimg.cc/4dPVtvWG/sav-in.png)](https://postimg.cc/8JF7gv8X)

# WHY BITSAVE?

😌It's easy - Everyone is familiar with the concept of putting money aside for a raining day. And our UX makes it understandable for users to take the savings journey onchain.

🧮It helps Personal Finance and Accountability for Web3 Natives who earn consistent income. Users can track their savings and manage withdrawals and expenses using Bitsave.
[![sav-plan.png](https://i.postimg.cc/pXgBtfjR/sav-plan.png)](https://postimg.cc/RNLt7nGD)

🧐Bitsave focus is on Savings, not investment, there are already superflous DeFi protocols that caters to investment purposes, Bitsave's Focus is on Savings only.


## SAFETY FIRST --> Bitsave Parent-Child Contract Structure 

The Child-Parent Contract Function in Bitsave is a contract structure feature that ensures users' funds remain safe;

**Savings Plan Creation:**
When a user sets up a savings plan on Bitsave, they are NOT depositing funds into a shared liquidity pool.

Instead, a child smart contract is automatically generated based on their selected savings parameters of time, amount, name etc

That contract is created when a user "Joins Bitsave", you can see it here👇🏽
[![join.png](https://i.postimg.cc/JzqTzm5G/join.png)](https://postimg.cc/cvv7FpjS)

Transaction hash
https://basescan.org/address/0x3593546078eecd0ffd1c19317f53ee565be6ca13


**Child Contracts & Security:**
Each child contract is directly linked to the user's wallet and funds are stored in this contract, making it isolated from other users' funds and preventing large-scale exploits.

Since the funds remain within individual contracts, any attempt to move them requires wallet approval from the user.

**Protection Against Exploits:**

If a hacker tries to breach Bitsave’s system, they won’t find a single pool of funds to drain.

Instead, they would have to individually compromise each user’s wallet by getting their approval for transactions.

For instance, if Bitsave has 50,000 users, an attacker would need to obtain 50,000 separate transaction approvals, making the exploit practically impossible.

**Compounding & User Benefits:**

Since the funds are stored in individual contracts, recurring savings and top ups make it easier for users to just manage their savings.

**Bitsave's introduction of SaveFi**
Decentralized Protection: Users retain ownership of their funds, reducing the risk of centralized failures or large-scale hacks.

No Third-Party Custody: Bitsave never holds user funds, aligning with non-custodial DeFi principles.

Enhanced Security Model: Even in a worst-case scenario, a hacker would need the user’s direct on-chain approval to steal funds, making mass exploitation nearly impossible.

*The Future of Savings in Web3 is Savefi*


## GOAL - 1 Million users 
Bring a million savers onchain with Bitsave in 2 years.


**Bitsave Events and Onboarding Sessions**
1. Onboarding Seniors during our Bitsave Pizza Party
[![DSC-4422.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/5ts5TRtX/DSC-4422.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/TyWWWQgx)

Tweet Report
https://x.com/BitsaveProtocol/status/1848739861081076009

2. Meeting with Local Business People and Onboarding them.
https://x.com/_karlagod/status/1854877185993056286?t=R42F7qUWFMiNrjnBj_i7ow&s=19



**Our Github Repo**
Contracts
https://github.com/CryptoSmartNow/bs_base

Front End
https://github.com/CryptoSmartNow/bitsave

**Our Contract**
https://basescan.org/address/0x3593546078eecd0ffd1c19317f53ee565be6ca13

answers.answer: Prosperity Account is a Celo-native Smart Account built on Safe that recognizes and rewards meaningful onchain impact activities. The first version will launch in April 2025.  Users can create a Prosperity Account and claim a .prosperity ID by connecting one of their wallets. Users will be rewarded Prosperity Points to level up their account based on a set of onchain activities, such as Proof of Ship score, Celo Citizen Retro, and Celo voting activity.  Users can connect more wallets, however each wallet can only be linked to 1 Prosperity account. When a Prosperity Account levels up, new perks, such as access gas coverage or retro rewards, are unlocked.  The Prosperity activities are curated by CeloPG to ensure full alignment with the objectives of the Celo ecosystem. Through a G$ integration we will enhance the utility of G$ and contribute to the token being distributed to impactful buidlers.

project.title: Prosperity Account: Rewarding onchain impact
project.description:
Prosperity Account is a Celo-native Smart Account built on Safe that recognizes and rewards meaningful onchain impact activities. The first version will launch in April 2025.

Users can create a Prosperity Account and claim a .prosperity ID by connecting one of their wallets. Users will be rewarded Prosperity Points to level up their account based on a set of onchain activities, such as Proof of Ship score, Celo Citizen Retro, and Celo voting activity. 

Users can connect more wallets, however each wallet can only be linked to 1 Prosperity account. When a Prosperity Account levels up, new perks, such as access gas coverage or retro rewards, are unlocked.

The Prosperity activities are curated by CeloPG to ensure full alignment with the objectives of the Celo ecosystem.

Tech
Prosperity Accounts are built on Safe{Core}, which provides them with battle-tested security and resiliency. Even if Prosperity Account's UI goes down, users can still use their accounts through the Safe{Wallet} and alternative UIs.

Badges and points are assigned with onchain attestations, and could also be used by other apps. 

G$ integration
Our team will integrate G$ into Prosperity Account by:
- Will fetch Universal Profiles to validate which PA clusters are verified.
- Include a G$ badge that recognizes and rewards users for the G$ earned. Over time additional badges for other G$ activities / services can be added.
- Include the GoodDapp in our UI once GoodDollar creates a Safe App.
- Create a new feature where G$ can be distributed as a tip to impactful builders based on their Prosperity Account level and certain badges. 

The development efforts will be executed by Kolektivo Labs, in collaboration with CeloPG. We'll track our milestones and progress of all integration efforts in Karma Gap and commit to completing the above activities by the end of Q2.

answers.answer: Pesia’s Kitchen’s EAT Initiative merges food rescue with financial empowerment using GoodDollar (G$). Students and volunteers sort, package, and distribute food, verifying participation through QR code scans. They earn G$ rewards, which can be used, donated, or traded, fostering engagement and digital financial literacy. Recipients can optionally onboard to G$, promoting economic inclusion. An NFT-backed funding model sustains operations by tokenizing meal distributions, allowing global supporters to contribute. By integrating G$ into volunteerism and food aid, EAT enhances G$ utility, incentivizes participation, and creates a transparent, community-driven solution for food security and financial empowerment.
answers.question: Project Description: Briefly describe your project and how it enhances G$ utility or adoption

answers.answer:
The EAT Initiative will leverage GoodDollar's JavaScript SDK to create a seamless reward system for food rescue operations. We'll develop a QR code verification platform where volunteers and students scan codes at distribution hubs, automatically triggering G$ rewards through GoodDollar's payment API. This platform will include:
Custom QR generation system tracking food rescue metrics
Mobile-optimized scanning interface for volunteers
Integration with GoodDollar's wallet creation and transaction APIs
Backend verification ensuring legitimate participation
Additionally, we'll implement an NFT marketplace using ERC-721 tokens representing meal distributions. Each NFT will contain metadata verifying impact and its URI will be embedded in a web of trust network following the Linked Claims specification developed at DIF Labs, enabling verifiable attestations across platforms. NFTs will be purchasable with G$, creating a sustainable funding mechanism. For recipients, we'll develop an optional onboarding flow to GoodDollar wallets, enhancing financial inclusion while maintaining transparent verification of all volunteer activities.
answers.question: Technical Implementation: Describe your approach and how it integrates with GoodDollar. For new builders, outline your implementation plan.

answers.answer:
LinkedTrust.us brings proven Web3 credentials expertise through multiple high-impact projects: developed an impact evaluator token drop leveraging Bacalhau & Ceramic; successfully ported Aca-py to VC standards; built a human credentialing oracle for HUMAN Protocol; and currently executing Year 2 of a US Chamber of Commerce Foundation grant creating portable skill credentials with OBV3 compatibility and wallet storage.  We think we can enhance GoodDollar's ecosystem with robust, interoperable identity infrastructure and portable credentials.
		https://github.com/openwallet-foundation/acapy  (contributor)
		https://github.com/Cooperation-org/linked-trust-impact-eval
		https://github.com/Cooperation-org/linked-claims-author
		https://github.com/Cooperation-org/linked-trust-content-mod
		https://www.linkedin.com/company/linkedtrust/
answers.question: Team Capability: Highlight your team's relevant experience and past delivery of similar projects, particularly in the Web3 space or with GoodDollar. Please add relevant links to members GitHub, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc as needed.

answers.answer:
Milestone 1: GoodDollar Integration (Weeks 1-4) Implement GoodDollar SDK for wallet creation. Develop QR system tracking volunteer activities with G$ transaction monitoring.
Milestone 2: G$ Reward Automation (Weeks 4-8) Build automated G$ distribution using GoodDollar's payment API with transaction verification. Create event-driven architecture for QR-triggered G$ rewards.
Milestone 3: NFT Impact Tokens (Weeks 9-12) Deploy ERC-721 contracts with LinkedClaims and G$ purchase gateway. Implement on-chain verification through GoodDollar's network.
Milestone 4: Student Recognition (depends on funding) Expand to 3+ distribution centers with 50+ student volunteers. Implement student-led governance for distribution priorities. Create platform for students to earn/track G$ contributions. Support students in teaching recipients about digital financial tools, positioning them as community experts.
Milestone 5: GoodDollar Ecosystem Growth (depends on funding) Develop student-led training resources while expanding GoodDollar adoption. Connect with additional schools, emphasizing G$'s role in financial empowerment and extending GoodDollar's reach to underserved communities.
answers.question: Roadmap & Milestones: Outline 3-5 key milestones with timeframes demonstrating how you'll deliver value to the GoodDollar ecosystem.

answers.answer: The EAT Initiative drives GoodDollar (G$) adoption by integrating it into food rescue efforts. Schools onboard students and volunteers, who earn G$ rewards for participation, promoting engagement and financial literacy. QR code verification ensures transparency, while gamification boosts retention. Partnerships with food organizations and blockchain communities expand reach. An NFT-backed funding model attracts crypto supporters, sustaining operations. Success is measured by user onboarding, QR scans, G$ transactions, and NFT sales. By linking G$ to real-world impact, EAT fosters digital financial inclusion, making blockchain rewards accessible while addressing food security through a transparent, community-driven model.
answers.question: User Adoption Strategy: How will you attract users to your project and drive G$ adoption? Include specific strategies or metrics. You can find more details on the engagement rewards to support this at: https://engagement-rewards.vercel.app/

answers.answer:
initial 2000 from mentors - engineers to produce the MVP
if get additional

40% enhancing engineering & design
40% on adoption and communication
20% on rewards for the food hubs
answers.question: Funding Allocation: How will you allocate the funding to maximize impact? Provide a simple breakdown of resource allocation.

answers.answer: The EAT Initiative complements GoodDollar's ecosystem by creating a new use case for G$ in food rescue operations, rather than competing with existing financial services. By integrating G$ into volunteer rewards and NFT impact funding, we drive new user adoption among students and food recipients who might otherwise lack exposure to digital currencies. Our LinkedClaims verification system enhances trust in G$ transactions while providing transparent impact metrics. This creates an educational onramp for community members to experience G$'s utility firsthand, building a bridge between humanitarian action and financial inclusion that strengthens GoodDollar's position as a force for social good.

answers.answer: AfriCycle is a blockchain-powered circular economy platform built on the Celo blockchain that tackles Africa’s waste management crisis across three major streams: plastic, electronic waste (e-waste), and metal/general waste. The platform incentivizes informal waste collectors with token rewards for verified collections, ensures transparent recycling through blockchain verification, and enables corporations to access certified recycling and carbon offset credits.  By integrating GoodDollar (G$), AfriCycle will utilize G$ as a key reward token, extending its utility into real-world impact sectors. Waste collectors will earn G$ for each verified collection, unlocking access to digital finance and helping grow G$ adoption in grassroots communities.
answers.question: Project Description: Briefly describe your project and how it enhances G$ utility or adoption

answers.answer:
AfriCycle will integrate with the GoodCollective by adapting its existing smart contracts and wallet infrastructure to support G$ payouts. The implementation plan includes:

Adding support for G$ in AfriCycle’s smart contract reward system.

Verifying waste collection using GPS data, weight metrics, and recycler validation.

Connecting G$ rewards to GoodDollar wallet infrastructure so users can easily access and use their earnings.

Forking components from GoodCollective’s open-source tools for wallet identity and reward tracking.

Building a “claim and earn” flow where G$ is issued based on validated activity.

G$ will act as a universal basic income booster for thousands of informal waste collectors, rewarding positive environmental actions.
answers.question: Technical Implementation: Describe your approach and how it integrates with GoodDollar. For new builders, outline your implementation plan.

answers.answer:
AfriCycle is led by Nasihudeen Jimoh, a full-stack  blockchain developer with a strong track record in ReFi, tokenization, and the Celo ecosystem. He has delivered multiple impactful Web3 projects including:

Fundly – A decentralized crowdfunding platform built on Celo that enables verified users to create campaigns, accept donations, and manage withdrawals with on-chain transparency.

Estoken – A pioneering real estate tokenization platform utilizing the ERC-1155 standard to enable fractional ownership, secondary market trading, and rental income distribution for tokenized property assets.

CeloSubPay – A DeFi-powered subscription payment protocol leveraging Celo stablecoins (cUSD/cEUR), offering automated recurring payments, AI-based credit risk assessments, and user-controlled smart contract authorizations.

Nasihudeen is a seasoned blockchain developer and a committed contributor to the Celo ecosystem. He has participated in multiple hackathon in the celo ecosystem some in which he won prizes, recognized for building impactful ReFi and Web3 solutions that promote financial inclusion. His expertise spans smart contracts, decentralized identity, and real-world data integration. Notably, he was selected as a recipient of the first ever  Celo Citizens Retro Funding, highlighting his dedication to open-source innovation and ecosystem growth

GitHub: https://github.com/Kanasjnr/
Twitter: https://x.com/KanasJnr
answers.question: Team Capability: Highlight your team's relevant experience and past delivery of similar projects, particularly in the Web3 space or with GoodDollar. Please add relevant links to members GitHub, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc as needed.

answers.answer:
Smart Contract Upgrade for G$ Support (Month 1)
Modify existing AfriCycle smart contracts to integrate native G$ token payouts, enabling transparent, on-chain reward distribution for verified recycling activities.

G$ Wallet Integration & Onboarding Tools (Month 2)
Integrate GoodDollar-compatible wallets into the platform and develop onboarding flows tailored for informal waste collectors with low digital literacy.

Internal Testing & Community Feedback Loop (Month 3–4)
Conduct targeted testing with early users and community partners to gather usability feedback, ensure wallet flows and reward systems are intuitive, and iterate based on real-world input.

Corporate Dashboard Launch (Month 4)
Release the AfriCycle Corporate Impact Dashboard, allowing businesses to fund verified recycling efforts using G$, view impact metrics, and claim sustainability credits.

Pilot Deployment in Lagos, Nigeria (Month 5)
Launch the full pilot in Lagos, onboarding 50+ waste collectors who earn G$ for every verified contributionvalidating G$ as an incentive for real-world environmental action.

Regional Expansion (Month 6–9)
Scale to three additional Nigerian cities, broadening access to G$ earning opportunities while growing the circular economy and GoodDollar user base.
answers.question: Roadmap & Milestones: Outline 3-5 key milestones with timeframes demonstrating how you'll deliver value to the GoodDollar ecosystem.

answers.answer:
AfriCycle’s strategy to onboard users and drive G$ adoption combines grassroots community partnerships, token incentives, and real-world utility. The approach is designed to create meaningful engagement across the waste value chain while expanding the GoodDollar ecosystem.

1. Strategic Partnerships

ReFi & Climate Collaborations: AfriCycle is actively exploring partnerships with members of ReFi DAO and other regenerative climate initiatives to align with mission-driven communities and tap into existing sustainability networks.

Local Waste Ecosystem Integration: We will partner with community-based recycling organizations, environmental NGOs, and informal waste collector cooperatives to reach underserved populations and facilitate grassroots onboarding.

2. Incentivized Onboarding

Waste collectors will earn tokenized incentives for verified recycling contributions, combining G$ and cUSD rewards to drive financial inclusion and initial momentum.

A portion of these rewards will be bonus-matched during early campaigns to accelerate adoption.

3. Real-World Utility for G$

AfriCycle will integrate with local merchants and service providers to enable G$ payments for essential goods like airtime, food, transport, and sanitation supplies, making earnings directly useful in daily life.

4. Community Engagement & Education

Through awareness campaigns, workshops, and digital storytelling, we will highlight environmental and social impact to build a loyal user base and catalyze viral growth on social platforms.

Target Metrics (First 6 Months)
500+ Monthly Active G$ Earners

250+ Tons of Verified Waste Collected

5+ Businesses Funding Cleanups or Accepting G$ Payments
answers.question: User Adoption Strategy: How will you attract users to your project and drive G$ adoption? Include specific strategies or metrics. You can find more details on the engagement rewards to support this at: https://engagement-rewards.vercel.app/

answers.answer:
25% – Smart contract development for G$ support

15% – Wallet and UI integration with GoodDollar tools

30% – On-ground onboarding and training of waste collectors

20% – G$ incentive program and engagement rewards

10% – Monitoring, verification, and impact reporting
answers.question: Funding Allocation: How will you allocate the funding to maximize impact? Provide a simple breakdown of resource allocation.

answers.answer: AfriCycle complements existing GoodDollar initiatives by expanding the G$ utility to new impact-driven verticals specifically waste management and ReFi. It brings grassroots communities into the ecosystem and enables corporations to support verified public goods initiatives using G$. Rather than competing, AfriCycle amplifies GoodDollar’s vision by creating measurable social and environmental value.
answers.question: Ecosystem Contribution: How does your project complement existing initiatives in the GoodDollar ecosystem rather than competing with them?

answers.answer: Yes
answers.question: Ethical Compliance: Confirm you have read and will comply with the ethical standards outlined in the eligibility criteria.

answers.answer: AfriCycle is exploring deeper partnerships with Celo ReFi projects, Regen Network, and WasteAid to strengthen our environmental impact credentials. We also plan to integrate on-chain Proof of Impact tracking and support from regenerative DAOs. G$ will play a key role in making that value visible and verifiable on-chain.

project.title: Afri-cycle
project.description:
# **AfriCycle: A Multi-Stream ReFi Waste Management Ecosystem**

## **Summary**

**AfriCycle** is a blockchain-powered circular economy platform built on the **Celo blockchain**, designed to tackle Africa's growing waste management crisis. The platform addresses three major waste streams:  

- **Plastic Waste**  
- **Electronic Waste (E-Waste)**  
- **Metal/General Waste**  

AfriCycle incentivizes waste collection through **tokenized rewards**, ensures **transparent recycling processes**, and promotes **corporate sustainability** via **verified recycling credits**. By connecting **informal waste collectors** with **recycling facilities** and **corporate partners**, AfriCycle fosters economic inclusion while addressing environmental challenges.

---

## **Project Overview**

AfriCycle represents a **transformative shift** in Africa’s waste management landscape by applying **Regenerative Finance (ReFi)** principles to convert environmental challenges into economic opportunities. The platform benefits multiple stakeholders and promotes sustainability across the continent.

---

## **Key Stakeholders**

- **Waste Collectors**  
  Informal workers gaining **financial inclusion** and **fair compensation**

- **Recycling Facilities**  
  Partners who receive **consistent, verified waste streams**

- **Corporations**  
  Entities seeking **verifiable sustainability credits** and **recycled materials**

- **Local Communities**  
  Beneficiaries of **cleaner environments** and **economic development**

---

## **Problem Statement**

### **Environmental Crisis**

Africa faces an overwhelming waste management crisis:

- **Plastic Waste**: 17 million tons generated annually  
- **E-Waste**: Over 2.9 million tons dumped each year  
- **Recycling Rate**: Only **4%** of total waste is recycled  

> The majority of waste is processed through **informal channels**, often **unverified** and **unregulated**.
---
### **Economic Challenges**

- **Uncontrolled Dumpsites**: Over **90%** of waste ends up in unmanaged landfills  
- **Low Earnings**: Informal waste collectors earn **less than $2/day**  
- **Financial Exclusion**: **57%** of Africa’s population lacks access to formal financial systems
---
### **Technological Gaps**
- Limited traceability in the waste value chain  
- No standardized verification for recycling claims  
- Inefficient and manual payment systems  
- Disconnected stakeholders (collectors, recyclers, corporations)
---
## **Solution: AfriCycle’s Innovation**

AfriCycle merges **blockchain technology** with **ReFi principles** to establish a **transparent, efficient, and scalable** waste management ecosystem.
---
## **Key Features & Benefits**

###  **Tokenized Incentives for Collectors**
- Waste collectors earn **cUSD (Celo stablecoin)** rewards  
- Encourages **financial inclusion** and **dignified compensation**

###  **Blockchain-Verified Recycling**
- Every collection and recycling action is **recorded on-chain**  
- Ensures **transparency**, **traceability**, and **fraud prevention**

###  **Sustainability for Corporations**
- Corporations receive **verified recycling credits**  
- Helps meet **ESG goals** and unlock **carbon offset opportunities**

###  **Streamlined Supply Chain**
- Seamless connection between **collectors**, **recyclers**, and **corporate buyers**  
- Reduces inefficiencies and promotes a **circular economy**

###  **Environmental Impact**
- Diverts waste from landfills  
- **Reduces pollution** and supports **eco-conscious behavior**  
- Encourages **sustainable resource management**

---

## **Conclusion**

AfriCycle offers a **holistic**, **technology-driven**, and **impact-oriented** approach to Africa’s waste crisis. By integrating:

- **Blockchain verification**  
- **Tokenized financial rewards**  
- **Corporate sustainability incentives**

AfriCycle creates a **scalable model** for environmental, economic, and social regeneration. Through its inclusive design and ecosystem approach, AfriCycle is set to **transform the waste management industry** across Africa and **drive sustainable impact at scale**.

answers.answer: A suite of 5 open-source dashboards delivering real-time, on-chain transparency for GoodDollar, enhancing G$ adoption by empowering stakeholders to verify UBI impact, governance accountability, and tokenomics health without intermediaries.
answers.question: Project Description: Briefly describe your project and how it enhances G$ utility or adoption

answers.answer:
Approach:

Data Source: Celo blockchain data filtered by GoodDollar’s contracts (UBI claims, governance, G$ token).

Tools: Dune Analytics for SQL queries and visualizations.

Integration: Dashboards map directly to core protocol mechanics (claims, swaps, governance votes).

Implementation Plan for New Builders:

Define Stakeholders: Identify roles (users, DAO, investors) and their needs.

Map Metrics: Prioritize KPIs (e.g., DAU for users, Gini coefficient for tokenomics).

Build Queries: Use Dune to extract and transform on-chain data.

Design Dashboards: Focus on clarity and zero overlap between dashboards.

answers.answer:
This project unifies and amplifies GoodDollar’s existing efforts by:

Governance Support: DAO members can independently audit proposals, treasury reserves, and voting patterns without relying on third-party reports.

Partnership Growth: The Celo dashboard quantifies GoodDollar’s value to the Celo ecosystem (e.g., fees generated, user activity), strengthening partnership pitches.

User Retention: Gamified claim streaks (via the User Profile dashboard) align with GoodDollar’s UBI mission, encouraging consistent engagement.

Open Framework: Unlike siloed analytics tools, this suite is public and modular—other DAOs can replicate the stakeholder-centric dashboard model for their ecosystems.

It does not compete; it turns raw data into a shared resource for all GoodDollar teams and stakeholders.

DAO Blueprint: This isn’t just a GoodDollar tool—it’s a standardized framework for DAOs to map stakeholders, define success metrics, and architect dashboards that balance transparency with usability.

Real-Time Accountability: Unlike manual reports, these dashboards update automatically, enabling stakeholders to act on live data (e.g., adjusting UBI parameters during volatility).

Academic Rigor: The stakeholder-first design ensures metrics answer real business questions (e.g., “Are we retaining users?” vs. vanity metrics).

project.title: The DAO Gold Standard for On-Chain Data Transparency
project.description:
- Problem
	GoodDollar’s contracts generate rich on-chain data, but insights today are siloed in proprietary tools. Investors, partners, and users lack open, self-service access to answer critical questions:
		"Is UBI reaching real users?"
		"Is the DAO allocating funds responsibly?"
		"Does G$ have sustainable liquidity?"

- Solution
	A suite of 5 open-source dashboards built on Dune Analytics, transforming raw blockchain data into actionable insights for every stakeholder:

		- UBI & Claims: Retention, streaks, dormant wallets.
		- Celo Activity: Fees, swaps, protocol impact.
		- Tokenomics: Supply, liquidity, holder distribution.
		- DAO & Governance: Treasury reserves, voting trends.
		- User Profiles: Personalized stats, leaderboards.

- Why Fund This?
	- Self-Service Transparency: Stakeholders verify metrics without intermediaries (investors vet UBI fairness, users track streaks, DAO audits spending).
	- Cost Efficiency: Eliminates reliance on paid analytics tools (built on free, open-source Dune).
	- Trustless Adoption: Attracts partners/investors with immutable proof of protocol health.
	- Industry Leadership: Positions GoodDollar as the model for DAO accountability in Web3.

- Strategic Value
	- For the DAO: Reduces reporting costs, empowers data-driven governance, and aligns with crypto’s “don’t trust, verify” ethos.
	- For the Ecosystem: Creates a public good—any DAO can replicate this framework to prove transparency.
	- For Web3: Sets a benchmark for evaluating DAO health (e.g., treasury collateralization, voter turnout).
	
- Built Open, Built for All.
	No gatekeepers, no subscriptions—just truth on-chain.

answers.answer: GoodDollar: Dune Spellbook Models enhances G$ utility and adoption by establishing a comprehensive analytics infrastructure on Dune Spellbook to track UBI distribution on the Celo blockchain. By transforming raw onchain data into structured, easily accessible models, this project provides deep insights into individual claims, aggregate statistics, and behavioral patterns. These data models improve transparency, empower researchers to analyze UBI efficiency and engagement, and enable ecosystem participants to make data-driven decisions. By increasing the accessibility and accuracy of GoodDollar’s financial data, this initiative strengthens trust, adoption, and usability of G$ within the broader Web3 community.
answers.question: Project Description: Briefly describe your project and how it enhances G$ utility or adoption

answers.answer: My approach leverages Dune Spellbook, a collaborative dbt framework, to transform raw blockchain data into structured analytics models focused on GoodDollar's UBI system on Celo. I'll extract and process transaction data from GoodDollar's smart contracts, implementing data models that track individual claims, daily aggregations, claimer statistics, and engagement patterns. The solution integrates directly with GoodDollar by monitoring on-chain events and contract interactions, requiring no additional infrastructure from the protocol team. My implementation plan includes developing SQL-based transformations, establishing comprehensive data tests for accuracy, and documenting each model thoroughly to ensure accessibility for community developers and researchers who wish to build upon this analytics foundation.
answers.question: Technical Implementation: Describe your approach and how it integrates with GoodDollar. For new builders, outline your implementation plan.

answers.answer:
I bring over 15 years of professional SQL development experience to this project, with specialized expertise in web3 analytics. As a major contributor to Dune Spellbook with 170+ merged PRs, I've developed analytics infrastructure across DeFi sectors including DEX trading, lending protocols, perpetuals markets, and on-chain attestations. Currently serving as the Dune Wizard for Nexus Mutual, I've demonstrated the ability to transform complex blockchain data into accessible analytics models. My experience includes collaborating with DAOs, building data quality dashboards, developing API integrations, and implementing blockchain data feeds for web3 projects. This diverse background in both traditional data engineering and blockchain-specific analytics positions me ideally to deliver comprehensive GoodDollar UBI analytics infrastructure.

https://github.com/tomfutago 
https://dune.com/tomfutago

1. Initial Data Model Implementation (Month 1-2)
- Submit first Dune Spellbook PRs, focusing on foundational models for claims tracking and claimer statistics (already completed).
- Conduct validation and refinement to ensure data accuracy and usability.

2. Expanding Analytics Models & R&D (Month 2-4)
- Research additional analytics needs within the GoodDollar ecosystem.
- Develop and deploy new models to enhance engagement tracking, behavioral analysis, and financial inclusion metrics.
- Improve data coverage and efficiency through iterative optimization.

3. Collaboration within Onchain Data Transparency Track (Ongoing)
- Work closely with the GoodDollar community and broader Celo ecosystem to ensure transparency and accessibility of onchain data.

4. Infrastructure Migration & Dashboard Development (Month 4-6)
- Support migration of GoodDollar’s data infrastructure to Dune, ensuring a seamless transition.
- Assist in moving the main GoodDollar analytics dashboard to Dune for improved data accessibility.
- Develop supplemental dashboards to provide deeper insights into UBI distribution, user engagement, and ecosystem trends.

5. Long-Term Sustainability & Knowledge Sharing (Month 6+)
- Document all models and methodologies to ensure long-term maintainability.
- Explore additional use cases for data-driven insights within the GoodDollar protocol.

project.title: GoodDollar: Dune Spellbook models
project.description:
This project establishes comprehensive analytics infrastructure within Dune Spellbook for tracking UBI distribution through the GoodDollar protocol on the Celo blockchain. Created data models capture individual transaction details to aggregate statistics and behavioral patterns.

Added data models ("spells") improve onchain data transparency for GoodDollar by enhancing the accessibility, accuracy, and usability of blockchain data for developers, community members, and ecosystem participants. Researchers can analyze UBI distribution efficiency, participant engagement, and financial inclusion metrics with ease.

Key capabilities include:
- Transaction-level tracking of all UBI claims with complete financial details
- Daily aggregation of claim metrics to identify temporal patterns
- Individual claimer profiles with comprehensive financial summaries
- Advanced engagement analytics through streak tracking and behavioral modeling

This infrastructure supports evidence-based decision making, provides transparency for stakeholders, and enables research capabilities on the real-world implementation of Universal Basic Income programs on blockchain networks. All models are designed with rigorous data validation to ensure reliability for critical economic analysis.
